Pattern Sequence for Designing Block chain Based Healthcare Information Technology Systems Peng Zhang Ph Belmont University Vanderbilt University Douglas Schmidt Ph Vanderbilt University Jules White Ph Vanderbilt University Known for its decentralized and tamper aware properties block chain is attractive to enhance the infrastructure of systems that have been constrained by traditionally centralized and vendor locked environments Although block chain has commonly been used as the operational model behind crypto currency it has far more foreseeable utilities in domains like healthcare where efc ent data ow is highly demanded Particularly block chain and related technologies have been touted as foundational technologies for addressing healthcare interoperability challenges such as promoting effective communications and securing data exchanges across various healthcare systems Despite the in creasing interests in leveraging block chain technology to improve healthcare infrastructures major gap in literature is the lack of available recommendations for concrete architectural styles and design considerations for creating block chain based apps and systems with health care focus This research provides two contributions to bridge the gap in existing research First we introduce pattern sequence for designing block chain based healthcare systems focused on secure and at scale data exchange Our approach adapts traditional software patterns and proposes novel patterns that take into account both the technical requirements spec ic to healthcare systems and the implications of these requirements on naive block chain based solutions Second we provide pattern oriented reference architecture using an example ap pli cation of the pattern sequence for guiding software developers to design interoperable on the technical level healthcare IT systems top block chain based infrastructures The reference architecture focuses on minimizing storage requirements on chain preserving the privacy of sensitive information facilitating scalable communications and maximizing evo lv ability of the system Categories and Subject Descriptors Software Engineering Distribution and Maintenance Documentation General Terms Design Documentation Additional KeyWords and Phrases Block chain Technology Software Engineering Design Patterns Smart Contracts Smart Contract Security and Vulnerability Healthcare Data Sharing Interoperability Solidity ACM Reference Format Zhang Schmidt and White Pattern Sequence for Designing Block chain Based Healthcare Information Technology Systems HILLSIDE Proc of Conf on Pattern Lang of Prog January YY pages

DCD Chain Credible Architecture of Digital Copyright Detection Based on Block chain cid Zhi li Chen Yu ting Wang Tian jiao Nia Hong Zhong School of Computer Science and Technology An hui University He fei China bAn hui Engineering Laboratory of oT Security Technologies An hui University He fei China Abstract Copyright detection is an eec ti ve method to prevent piracy However un trustworthy detection parties may lead to fal sie detection results Due to its credibility and tamper resistance block chain has been applied to copyright protection Previous works mainly utilized block chain for reliable copyright in formation storage or copyrighted digital media trading As far as we know the problem of credible copyright detection has not been addressed In this paper we propose credible copyright detection architecture based on the block chain called DCD Chain In this architecture the detection agency rst detects copy right so the chain then uploads the detection records to the block chain Since data on the block chain are publicly accessible media providers can verify the correctness of the copyright detection and appeal to smart contract if there is any dissent The smart contract then arbitrates the disputes by verifying the correctness of detection on the chain The detect verify and arbitrate me ch an is guarantees the credibility of copyright detection Privacy and security analysis and experimental simulations show that the digital copyright detection architecture is reliable secure and ec ent Keywords block chain copyright detection smart contract cid Fully documented templates are available in the els article package on CT AN Email addresses zl chen ahu edu cn Zhi liChen wang com Yut in gWang tj ni com Tian jia oN zhong mail us tc edu cn Hong Zhong Pre print submitted to Journal of LATEX Templates October

Date of publication xxxx date of current version xxxx Digital Object Identifier ACCESS Doi Number Block chain for Multi Robot Collaboration to Combat OVID and Future Pandemics Al sam hi Brian Lee IBB University Ibb Yemen Correspondence al sam hi rs ece it hu ac in ABSTRACT This conceptual paper overviews how block chain technology is involving the operation of multi robot collaboration for combating OVID and future pandemics Robots are promising technology for providing many tasks such as spraying disinfection cleaning treating detecting high body temperature mask absence and delivering goods and medical supplies experiencing an epidemic OVID For combating OVID many heterogeneous and homogenous robots are required to perform different tasks for supporting different purposes in the quarantine area Controlling and decentralizing multi robot play vital role in combating OVID by reducing human interaction monitoring delivering goods Block chain technology can manage multi robot collaboration in decentralized fashion improve the interaction among them to exchange information share representation share goals and trust We highlight the challenges and provide the tactical solutions enabled by integrating block chain and multi robot collaboration to combat OVID pandemic The framework of our conceptual proposed can increase the intelligence decentralization and autonomous operations of connected multi robot collaboration in the block chain network We overview block chain potential benefits to defining framework of multi robot collaboration applications to combat OVID epidemics such as monitoring and outdoor and hospital End to End delivery systems Furthermore we discuss the challenges and opportunities of integrated block chain multi robot collaboration and the Internet of Things oT for combating OVID and future pandemics INDEX TERMS Block chain multi robot collaboration decentralization pandemic quarantine OVID spray disinfection delivery system infectious diseases

Scalable Consensus Protocols for PoW based Block chain and block DAG BS war oop Reddy Member IEEE and Sharma Member IEEE Abstract This paper proposes two models for scaling the transaction throughput in Proof of Work PoW based block chain networks mathematical model has been derived for optimal transaction throughput for PoW based longest chain rule block chain in the rst approach In this approach the block chain Peer to Peer network is considered as Erdo Re nyi random network topology However this approach is limited by the block creation rate and the results suggest that the rate beyond an optimal point can result in unfairness in the system The second approach is new consensus protocol proposed by considering the ledger as Directed cyclic Graph DAG called block DAG instead of chain of blocks This framework follows two step strategy that makes the system robust enough to handle the double spend attacks The rst step involves developing an unsupervised learning graph clustering algorithm for separating the blocks created by an attacker In the second step after eliminating the attackers blocks the remaining blocks are arranged in topological order by honest clients making the block DAG ledger system suitable for smart contract applications found in Internet of Things oT services The simulation results demonstrate sign cant improvement in the transaction throughput compared to bitcoin and the networks fairness Index Terms Block creation rate Delay Diameter Peer to Peer Transaction Throughput Directed cyclic Graph DAG Block DAG Consensus Unsupervised Learning Graph Clustering Topological Sort Internet of Things oT

Case for Currency less Economy Based on Bartering with Smart Contracts Carlos Molina Jimenez Haze Danny Al Nak ib Lin mao Song Ioann is fy rak is and Jon Crow croft Department of Computer Science and Technology University of Cambridge carlos molina cl cam ac uk https www cl cam ac uk cm jon crow croft cl cam ac uk Department of Computer Science University College London haze danny nak ib gmail com Independent researcher lin mao song gmail com School of Computing Newcastle University UK ioann is fy rak is ncl ac uk University of Cambridge Oct Abstract We suggest the reintroduction of bartering to create cry to currency less currency less and money less economy segment We con tend that barter economy would be net enterprises individuals gov ern ment and societies For instance the availability of an online peer to peer barter marketplace would convert ordinary individuals into po tent al traders of both tangible and digital items and services For exam ple they will be able to barter les and data that they collect Equally motivating they will be able to barter and reintroduce to the ec on my items that they no longer need such as books garden tools and bikes which are normally kept and wasted in garages and sheds We argue that most of the pieces of technology needed for building barter system are now available including block chains smart contracts cryptography secure multiparty computations and fair exchange protocols However additional research is needed to rene and integrate the pieces together We discuss potential research directions Keywords barter bartering smart contracts block chains fair exchange at money cash banking crypto currencies

Tender mint Light Client Sean Bra thwaite Ethan Buch man Ismail Kho Igor Konno Za rko Mi lose vic Romain Rue tsch and Josef Wi der Informal Systems Lazy Ledger October Abstract In Tender mint block chains the proof of stake mechanism and the underlying consensus al gori th entail dynamic fault model that implies that the active validator nodes that sign blocks may change over time and quorum of these validator is assumed to be correct only for limited period of time called trusting period The changes of the validator set are under control of the block chain application and are committed in every block In order to check what is the state of the block chain application at some height one needs to know the validator set at that height so that one can verify the corresponding digital signatures and hashes nave way of determining the validator set for height requires one to download all blocks before ii verify blocks by checking digital signatures and hashes and iii execute the corresponding transactions so the changes in the validator sets are reproduced This can potentially be very slow and computationally and data intensive In this paper we formalize the dynamic fault model imposed by Tender mint and describe light client protocol that allows to check the state of the block chain application that in realistic settings reduces sign cant ly the amount of data needed to be downloaded and the number of required computationally expensive signature ver cation operations In addition to mathematical proofs we have formalized the light client protocol in LA and checked safety and live ness with the PALA CHE model checker

The Shift to Communications Vision and Requirements Muhammad Was eem Akhtar Syed Ali Hassan Ri zw an Gh aar Hae joon Jung hil Gar and Shamim Hossain School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science SEE CS National University of Sciences and Technology NU ST Islamabad Pakistan en gr was eem akhtar see cs edu pk ali hassan see cs edu pk Wi Fi division of Broad com San Jose CA USA ri wang ha far gmail com Department of Information and Telecommunication Engineering Incheon National University Incheon Korea hae joon jung in ac kr Electrical Engineering Department Ecole de techno logie superieure Montreal QC Canada hil gar ieee org Department of Software Engineering College of Computer and Information Sciences King Saud University Riyadh Saudi Arabia ms hossain su edu Abstract The sixth generation wireless communication network is expected to integrate the terrestrial aerial and maritime com mu nica ions into robust network which would be more reliable fast and can support massive number of devices with ultra low latency requirements The researchers around the globe are proposing cutting edge technologies such as art ici al intelligence machine learning ML quantum com muni cation quantum machine learning QM block chain tera Hertz and millimeter waves communication tactile Internet non orthogonal multiple access NOMA small cells communication fog edge com put ing etc as the key technologies in the realization of beyond and communications In this article we provide detailed overview of the network dimensions with air interface and associated potential technologies More spec ic ally we highlight the use cases and app lica ions of the proposed networks in various dimensions Furthermore we also discuss the key performance indicators PI for the network challenges and future research opportunities in this domain Keywords quantum machine learning art ici al intelligence quan tum communication block chain Beyond

PoS AT Proof of Work Availability and Unpredictability without the Work So ub hik Deb ree ram Kann an David Tse cid Email so ub hik uw edu ks ree ram uw edu dn tse stanford edu University of Washington cid Stanford University Abstract An important feature of Proof of Work PoW block chains is full dynamic availability allowing miners togo online ando in while requiring only of the online miners to be honest Existing Proof of stake PoS Proof of Space and related protocols are able to achieve this property only partially either requiring the additional assumption that adversary nodes are online from the beginning and no new ad ver ary nodes come online afterwards or use additional trust assumptions for newly joining nodes We propose new PoS protocol PoS AT which can provably achieve dynamic availability fully without any additional assumptions The protocol is based on the longest chain and use saVer able Delay Function for the block proposal lottery to provide narrow of time The security analysis of the protocol draws on the recently pro posed technique of Nakamoto blocks as well as the theory of branching random walks An additional feature of PoS AT is the complete un pre dic ability of who will get to propose block next even by the winner itself This unpredictability is at the same level of PoW protocols and is stronger than that of existing PoS protocols using Veria ble Random Functions

Flexible Decentralized Access Control for Smart Buildings with Smart Contracts LEE PAK SHI INDRA ALVIN ENG OMID ARDA KANI AN and ELEN IS TROU LIA Un iver it of Alberta Canada Canada Large commercial buildings are complex cyber physical systems containing expensive and critical equipment that ensure the safety and comfort of their numerous occupants Yet occupant and visitor access to spaces and equipment within these buildings are still managed through un systematic inefficient and human intensive processes As standard practice long term building occupants are given access privileges to rooms and equipment based on their organizational roles while visitors have to be escorted by their hosts This ap roach is conservative and inflexible In this paper we describe methodology that can flexibly and securely manage building access privileges for long term occupants and short term visitors like taking into account the risk associated with accessing each space within the building Our methodology relies on block chain smart contracts to describe grant audit and revoke fine grained permissions for building occupants and visitors in decentralized fashion The smart contracts are specified through process that leverages the information compiled from Brick and BOT models of the building We illustrate the proposed method through atypical application scenario in the context of real office building and argue that it can greatly reduce the administration overhead while at the sametime providing fine grained audi table access control CCS Concepts Security and privacy Security services Computer systems organization Em bedded and cyber physical systems Sensors and actuators Additional KeyWords and Phrases Block chain Smart Contracts Access Control Ontology Smart Buildings

Multi Shard Private Transactions for Permission ed Block chains Ell And rou la ki Angelo De Caro Ka out ar Elk hi ya oui Christian Gore no Alessandro or nio tt and Marko Vu koli IBM Research Zurich University of Waterloo Abstract Traditionally block chain systems involve sharing transaction information across all block chain network participants Clearly this in tro duce barriers to the adoption of the technology by the enterprise world where preserving the privacy of the business data is necessity Previous or ts to bring privacy and block chains together either still leak partial information are restricted in their functionality or use costly mechanisms like NARKs In this paper we propose the Multi Shard Private Transaction MSP protocol novel privacy preserving protocol for permission ed block chains which relies only on simple crypto graphic primitives and targeted dissemination of information to achieve atom city and high performances

Fundamental Properties of the Layer Below Payment Channel Network Extended Version Matthias Gr und mann Hannes Hartenstein Karlsruhe Institute of Technology Karlsruhe Germany rst name lastname kit edu Abstract Payment channel networks area highly discussed approach for improving cal ability of crypto currencies such as Bitcoin As they allow processing transaction so chain pay ment channel networks are referred to as second layer technology while the block chain is the rst layer We uncouple payment channel networks from block chains and look at them as rst class citizens This brings up the question what model payment channel networks require as rst layer In response we formalize model called FL model for rst layer below payment channel network While transactions are globally made available by block chain the FL model only provides the reduced property that transaction is delivered to the users being aec ted by transaction We show that the reduced models properties still su ce to implement payment channels By showing that the FL model can not only be instantiated by the Bitcoin block chain but also by trusted third parties like banks we show that the reduction widens the design space for the rst layer Further we show that the stronger property provided by block chains allows for optimization that can be used to reduce the time for locking collateral during payments over multiple hops in payment channel network

De HiDe Deep Learning based Hybrid Model to Detect Fake News using Block chain cid Pr as hansa Agra wal Par wat Singh Anjana and thy Peri cid cid Department of SE Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad India cs tech ii th ac in cs resch ii th ac in thy se ii th ac in Abstract The surge in the spread of misleading information lies pro pag and and false facts frequently known as fake news raised questions concerning social medias in en ce into days fast moving democratic so cie ty The widespread and rapid dissemination of fake news cost us in many ways For example individual or societal costs by hampering ele ions integrity sign cant economic losses by impacting stock markets or increases the risk to national security It is challenging to overcome the spreading of fake news problems in traditional centralized systems How ever Block chain distributed decentralized technology that ensures data provenance authenticity and trace ability by providing trans par ent immutable and veria ble transaction records can help in detecting and contending fake news This paper proposes novel hybrid model De HiDe Deep Learning based Hybrid Model to Detect Fake News using Block chain The De HiDe is block chain based framework for legitimate news sharing by lte ring out the fake news It combines the be net of block chain with an intelligent deep learning model to reinforce robust ness and accuracy in combating fake news hurdle It also compares the proposed method to existing state of the art methods The De HiDe is expected to outperform state of the art approaches in terms of services features and performance Keywords Block chain Provenance Deep Learning Fake News De tec tion

BBB Voting Self Tallying out of Block chain Based Boardroom Voting arad Ven gopalan Ivan Homo lia Member IEEE Zeng peng Li Paw el zal chow ski Abstract Voting is means to agree on collective decision based on available choices candidates where participants voters agree to abide by their outcome To improve some features of voting decentralized solutions based on block chain can be employed where the block chain represents public bulletin board that in contrast to centralized bulletin board provides availability and censorship resistance block chain ensures that all entities in the voting system have the same view of the actions made by others due to its immutable and append only log The existing block chain based boardroom voting solution called Open Voting Network OV provides the privacy of votes and perfect ballot secrecy but it supports only two choices We present BBB Voting an equivalent block chain based approach for decentralized voting such as OV but in contrast to it BBB Voting supports out of choices and provides fault tolerance mechanism that enables recovery from stalling participants We provide cost optimized implementation using there um which we compare with OV and show that our work decreases the costs for voters by in terms of gas consumption cid

BIAS RESISTANT SOCIAL NEWS AGGREGATOR BASED ON BLOCK CHAIN PRE PRINT Amir Zia shah abi Mohammad Ali Madda Ali Department of Computer Engineering Department of Electrical Engineering Sharif University Sharif University zia shah abi ce sharif edu madda ali sharif edu Abbas Heydar noor Department of Computer Engineering Sharif University heydar noor sharif edu October ABSTRACT Into days world social networks have become one of the primary sources for creation and propagation of news Social news aggregator are one of the actors in this area in which users post news items and use positive or negative votes to indicate their preference toward news item News items will be ordered anddisplayed according to their aggregated votes This approach suffers from several problems raging from being prone to the dominance of the majority tod if cult yin discerning between correct and fake news and lack of incentive for honest behaviors In this paper we propose graph based news aggregator in which instead of voting on the news items users submit their votes on the relations between pairs of news items More precisely if user believes two news items support each other he will submit positive vote on the link between the two items and if he believes that two news items undermine each other he will submit negative vote on the corresponding link This approach has several desirable features This will reduce the contribution of personal preferences on voting One may disagree with two news items but still nd them supporting each other In the resulting graph all news items related to one news item act as evidence for that item endorsing or disputing it This approach helps the newsreader to understand different aspects of news item better We also introduce an incentive layer that uses block chain as distributed transparent manager to encourages users to behave honestly and abstain from adversary behaviors The incentive layer takes into account that users can have different viewpoints toward news enabling users from wide range of viewpoints to contribute to the network and be net from its rewards In addition we introduce protocol that enables us to prove fraud in computations of the incentive layer model on the block chain Ultimately we will analyze the fraud proof protocol and examine our incentive layer on wide range of synthesized datasets Keywords Block chain Social news aggregator Behavior consistency

Leveraging Technology for Healthcare and Retaining Access to Personal Health Data to Enhance Personal Health and Well being yan Chatterjee Ali Shah aab Martin Ger des Santiago Martinez and Pan kaj Khat iwad Department of Information and Communication Technology Centre for Health University of Agder Kristian and Norway yan chatterjee martin ger des pan kaj khat iwad uia no Cardiff School of Technologies Cardiff Metropolitan University CF YB Cardiff United Kingdom asha haab cardiff met ac uk Department of Health and Nursing Science Centre for Health University of Agder Kristian and Norway santiago martinez uia no Abstract Health data is sensitive category of personal data It might result in high risk to individual and health information handling rights and opportunities unless there is palatable defense Reasonable security standards are needed to protect electronic health records HR All personal data handling needs adequate explanation Maintaining access to medical data even in the developing world would favor health and well being across the world Unfortunately there are still countries that hinder the portability of medical records Numerous occurrences have shown that it still takes weeks for the medical data to be ported from one general physician GP to another Cross border portability is nearly impossible due to the lack of technical infrastructure and standardization We demonstrate the difficulty of the portability of medical records with some example case studies as collaborative engagement exercise through data mapping process to describe how different people and data points interact and evaluate HR portability techniques We then propose block chain based HR system that allows secure and cross border sharing of medical data The ethical and technical challenges around having such system have also been discussed in this study Keywords HR Public Health Portability Security Block chain Authentication Authorization Ethics

Multi scale characteristics of the emerging global crypto currency market Marcin Wt or eka Stanis aw roda Jaro saw Kwa pie Ludovico Mina tia Pa we Ow ici mk Marek St anus ze kb Complex Systems Theory Department Institute of Nuclear Physics Polish Academy of Sciences ul Rad zi ko ski ego Krak Poland Faculty of Computer Science and Telecommunications Cracow University of Technology ul Wars za ska Krak Poland Faculty of Physics Astronomy and Applied Computer Science Jagiellonian University ul oj as ie wi cz Krak Poland Abstract Modern nanci al markets are characterized by rapid ow of information vast number of participants having divers ed investment horizons and multiple feedback mechanisms which collectively lead to the emergence of complex phenom ena for example speculative bubbles or crashes As such they are considered as one of the most complex systems known Numerous studies have illuminated tyl zed facts also called complexity characteristics which are observed across the vast majority of nanci al markets These include the so called fat tails of the returns distribution volatility clustering the long memory strong stochastic it alongside non linear correlations persistence and the eec ts resembling fractal it and even multi fractal it The striking development of the crypto currency market over the last few years from being entirely peripheral to capitalizing at the level of an intermediate size stock exchange provides unique opportunity to observe its evolution in short period The availability of high frequency data allows conducting advanced statistical analysis of uc tu at ions on crypto currency exchanges right from their birth up to the present day This opens window that allows quantifying the evolutionary changes in the complexity characteristics which accompany market emergence and maturation The purpose of the present review then is to examine the properties of the crypto currency market and the associated phenomena The aim is to clarify to what extent after such an impetuous development the characteristics of the complexity of exchange rates on the crypto currency market have become similar to traditional and mature markets such as stocks bonds commodities or currencies The review introduces the history of crypto currencies oe ring description of the block chain technology behind them Dieren ces between crypto currencies and the exchanges on which they are traded have been consistently shown The central part of the review surveys the analysis of crypto currency price changes on various platforms The statistical properties of the uc tu at ions in the crypto currency mar ket have been compared to the traditional markets With the help of the latest statistical physics methods namely the multi fractal cross correlation analysis and marcin wat or ek pk edu pl stanislaw dr oz dz if edu pl Pre print submitted to Physics Reports March

Byzantine Consensus Christian Berger Hans Reiser Joo Sousa and lyss on Be sani Abstract With upcoming block chain infrastructures world spanning Byzantine consensus is getting practical and necessary In geographically distributed systems the pace at which consensus is achieved is limited by the heterogeneous latencies of connections between replicas If deployed on wide area network consensus based systems be net from weighted replication an approach that utilizes extra replicas and assigns higher voting weights to well connected replicas This approach enables more choice in quorum formation and replicas can leverage proportionally smaller quorums to advance thus decreasing consensus latency However the system needs solution to autonomously adjust to its environment if network conditions change or faults occur We present Adaptive Wide Area REplication AWARE mechanism that improves the geographical cal ability of consensus with nodes being widely spread across the world Essentially AWARE is an automated and dynamic voting weight tuning and leader positioning scheme which supports the emergence of fast quorums in the system It employs reliable self monitoring process and provides prediction model seeking to minimize the systems consensus latency In experiments using several AW SEC regions AWARE dynamically optimizes consensus latency by self reliant lynd inga fast cong ration yielding latency gains observed by clients located across the globe Index Terms adapt iv ness weighted replication consensus geo replication Byzantine fault tolerance self optimization block chain to remove duplicated code or unused smart contracts In this paper we afford this problem creating Smart Corpus Corpus of Smart Contracts in an organized reasoned and up to date repository where Threats and Opportunities Block chain meets Quantum Computation Wei Cui Tong Dou and Shil Yan School of Automation Science and Engineering South China University of Technology Guangzhou China This article considered dec ien cie of the our shing block chain technology manifested by the development of quantum computation We show that the future block chain technology would under constant threats from the following aspects Speedup the generation of nonce Faster searching for hash collisions Break the security of the classical encryption We also demonstrate that incorporating some quantum properties into block chain makes it more robust and more ec ent For example people can establish quantum security block chain system that utilizes quantum key distribution and quantum synchronization and detectable Byzantine agreement DB can help the block chain systems achieve faster consensus even if there exist number of malicious nodes PAC numbers

Probabilistic In distinguish ability and the Quality of Validity in Byzantine Agreement Guy Go ren Yo ram Moses and Alexander Spiegel man Tech ni on Novi Research Abstract Lower bounds and impossibility results in distributed computing are both intellectually challenging and practically important Hundreds if not thousands of proofs appear in the literature but surprisingly the vast majority of them apply to deterministic algorithms only Probabilistic distributed problems have been around for atleast four decades and receive lot of attention with the emergence of block chain systems Nonetheless we are aware of only handful of randomized lower bounds In this paper we provide formal framework to reason about randomized distributed al go rit hms We generalize the notion of in distinguish ability the most useful tool in deterministic lower bounds to apply to probabilistic setting The power of this framework is applied to completely characterize the quality of decisions in the randomized multi valued Consensus problem in an asynchronous environment with Byzantine faults That is we provide tight bound on the probability of honest parties deciding on possibly bogus value and prove that in precise sense no algorithm can do better The research of Guy Go ren was partly supported by grant from the Tech ni on Hiroshi Fujiwara cyber security research center and the Israel cyber bureau as well as by Jacobs fellowship Yo ram Moses is the Israel Poll ak academic chair at the Tech ni on His work was supported in part by the Israel Science Foundation under grant and by the Israel Bi national Science Foundation under grant

JOURNAL OF LATEX CLASS FILES VOL NO AUGUST Toko in Coin Based Accountable Access Control Scheme for Internet of Things Chun chi Liu Ming hui Xu He chuan Guo Xi zhen Cheng Fellow IEEE Yin hao Xiao Dong xiao Yu Bei Gong Arkady Ye rukh imo vich Sheng ling Wang and Wei feng Lv Abstract With the prevalence of Internet of Things oT applications oT devices interact closely with our surrounding environments bringing us unparalleled smartness and convenience However the development of secure oT solutions is getting along way lagged behind making us exposed to common unauthorized accesses that may bring malicious attacks and unprecedented danger to our daily life Over privilege attack widely reported phenomenon in oT that accesses unauthorized or excessive resources is notoriously hard to prevent trace and mitigate To tackle this challenge we propose Toko in Based Access Control BAC an accountable access control model enabled by block chain and Trusted Execution Environment TEE technologies to offer ne grain in ess strong audit ability and access procedure control for oT BAC materializes the virtual access power into de nite amount and secure cryptographic coin termed toko in token coin and manages it using atomic and accountable state transition functions in block chain toko in can be created only by the resource owner and is programmed with ne grained access policy de ning who is allowed to do what at when in whereby how Such policy species the access requirements the to be satis ed for granting the access and access behavioral constraints the that must be strictly followed during the resource access To the best of our knowledge we are the rst to realize such an access procedure control that governs actual access operations throughout the whole access process The strong audit ability is achieved with block chain and TEE enabled trusted access control object such that trust can be extended from on chain to off chain making all access activities securely monitored and audi table The toko in is peer to peer transferable and can be mo died only by the resource owner when necessary realizing dynamic and ex ble access control that can accommodate the ever changing physical world without relaxing any security requirement We fully implement BAC with well studied cryptographic primitives and block chain platforms and present readily available APP for regular users We also present case study to demonstrate how BAC is employed to enable autonomous in home cargo delivery while guaranteeing the access policy compliance and homeowners physical security by regulating the physical behaviors of the delivery man Index Terms Access Control Access Procedure Control Fine Grain in ess Strong Audit ability Over privilege Attack Block chain oT Trusted Proof of Authenticity of Logistics Information with Passive RFID Tags and Block chain Hiroshi Watanabe Kenji Saito Satoshi Miyazaki Toshi haru Okada Hiroyuki Fukuyama Tsu neo Kato Kat suo Taniguchi Abstract In tracing the robotic ally automated logistics of large quantities of goods inexpensive passive RFID tags are preferred for cost reasons Accordingly security between such tags and readers have primarily been studied among many issues of RFID However the authenticity of data cannot be guaranteed if logistics services can give false in for mati on Although the use of block chain is often discussed it is simply recording system so there is risk that false records maybe written to it As solution we propose design in which digitally signing location constrained and tamper evident reader atomic ally writes an evidence to block chain along with its reading and writing tag By semi formal modeling wec on med that the conde nti ali ty and integrity of the information can be maintained throughout the system and digitally signed data can be ve ried later despite possible com pro mise of private keys or signature algorithms or expiration of public key cert cates We also introduce prototype design to show that our proposal is viable This makes it possible to trace authentic logistics information us ing inexpensive passive RFID tags Furthermore by abstracting the reader writer as sensor actuator this model can be extended to oT in general

Alabama at Birmingham Alabama USA Department of Software Engineering King Saud University Riyadh Saudi Arabia Corresponding Author Lewis ken yer eye Email ken ye le sejong ac kr Received XX Month Accepted XX Month Abstract The Internet of Medical Things IoM offers an infrastructure made of smart medical equipment and software applications for health services Through the internet the IoM is capable of providing remote medical diagnosis and timely health services The patients can use their smart devices to create store and share their electronic health records HR with variety of medical personnel including medical doctors and nurses However unless the underlying com mi nation within IoM is secured malicious users can intercept modify and even delete the sensitive HR data of patients Patients also lose full control of their HR since most health services within IoM are constructed under centralized platform outsourced in the cloud Therefore it is appealing to design decentralized audi table and secure HR system that guarantees absolute access control for the patients while ensuring privacy and security Using the features of block chain including decentralization audit ability and immutability we propose secure HR framework which is mainly maintained by the medical centers In this framework the patients HR data are encrypted and stored in the servers of medical institutions while the corresponding hash values are kept on the block chain We make use of security primitives to offer authentication integrity and confidentiality of HR data while access control and immutability is guaranteed by the block chain technology The security analysis and performance evaluation of the proposed framework confirms its efficiency Keywords Internet of Medical Things IoM security privacy preservation block chain access control

Golden Grain Building Secure and Decentralized Model Marketplace for MLa aS Ji as We ng Jian We ng Member IEEE Cheng jun Cai Hong wei Huang Cong Wang Fellow IEEE Abstract ML as service MLa aS becomes increasingly popular and revolutionizes the lives of people natural requirement for MLa aS is however to provide highly accurate prediction services To achieve this current MLa aS systems integrate and combine multiple well trained models in their services Yet in reality there is no easy way for MLa aS providers especially for startup to collect ufc ent ly well trained models from individual developers due to the lack of incentives In this paper we aim to ll this gap by building up model marketplace called as Golden Grain to facilitate model sharing which enforces the fair model money swapping process between individual developers and MLa aS providers Spec ic ally we deploy the swapping process on the block chain and further introduce block chain empowered model benchmarking process for transparently determining the model prices according to their authentic performances so as to motivate the faithful contributions of well trained models Especially to ease the block chain overhead for model benchmarking our marketplace carefully of ads the heavy computation and designs secure off chain on chain interaction protocol based on trusted execution environment TEE for ensuring both the integrity and authenticity of benchmarking We implement prototype of our Golden Grain on the there um block chain and conduct extensive experiments using standard benchmark datasets to demonstrate the practically affordable performance of our design Index Terms ML as service Block chain Marketplace Trusted execution environment cid

Impact of Temporary Fork on the Evolution of Mining Pools in Block chain Networks An Evolutionary Game Analysis Can hui Chen Xu Chen Senior Member IEEE Jiang shan Yu Member IEEE Wei gang Wu Member IEEE and Di Wu Senior Member IEEE Abstract Temporary for kisa fundamental phenomenon in many block chains with proof of work and the analysis of temporary fork has recently drawn great attention Different from existing efforts that focus on the block chain system factors such as block size network propagation delay or block generation speed in this paper we explore new key dimension of computing power from the miners perspective Spec ic ally we rst propose detailed mathematical model to characterize the impact of computing power competition of the mining pools on the temporary fork We also derive closed form formula of the probability of temporary fork and the expected mining reward of mining pool To reveal the long term trends on the computing power distributions over the competing mining pools we then develop an evolutionary game framework based on the temporary fork modeling and accordingly characterize the set of stable evolution equilibrium Both extensive numerical simulations and realistic block chain database devaluation provide evidence to support our theoretical models and discoveries Index Terms Block chain temporary fork evolutionary game theory evolution equilibrium cid

TD ACS an BAC and Trust based Dynamic Access Control Scheme in Had oop Min Yang Sichuan University Chengdu China Abstract The era of big data has promoted the vigorous development of many industries boosting the full potential of holistic data driven analysis Had oop has become the primary choice for mainstream platforms used by stakeholders to process big data Thereafter the security of Had oop platform has arisen tremendous attention worldwide In this paper we mainly concentrate on enforcing access control on users to ensure platform security First we leverage access proxy integrated with attribute based access control BAC model to implement front end authorization which can fully reflect and cope with the flexible nature of the complex access control process in Had oop platform as well as can release back end resources from complex authorization process through access proxy Moreover in order to ensure the fine granularity of authorization the access proxy maintains list composed of trust threshold value provided by each resource according to its importance The access proxy interacts with the block chain network to obtain the user's trust evaluation value which serves as an important basis for dynamic authorization determination More specifically block chain network works together on chain and off chain modes The user's historical behavior data is stored off chain and the corresponding hash value is anchored on chain Consequently the user's trust value is evaluated based on his historical behavior stored on the block chain platform Meanwhile the authenticity of user behavior data can be guaranteed there by ensuring the reliability of trust assessment results Our experiment demonstrates that the proposed model can dynamically and flexibly adjust user permissions to ensure the security of the platform while time and money are consumed within reasonable range Keywords Access proxy BAC block chain trust evaluation access control

achieve consensus when by observing the output of some acceptor they all arrive at the same value Consensus is crucial for ordering transactions in failure tolerant systems Traditional consensus algorithms are homogeneous in three ways all learners are treated equally all acceptor are treated equally and all failures are treated equally These assumptions however are unsuitable for cross domain applications including block chains where not all acceptor are equally trustworthy and not all learners have the same assumptions and priorities We present the rst consensus algorithm to be heterogeneous in all three respects Learners set their own mixed failure tolerances over die rent ly trusted sets of acceptor We express these assumptions in novel Learner Graph and demonstrate uci ent conditions for consensus We present Heterogeneous Pax os an extension of Byzantine Pax os Heterogeneous Pax os achieves consensus for any viable Learner Graph in best case three message sends which is optimal We present proof of concept implementation and demonstrate how tailoring for heterogeneous scenarios can save resources and reduce latency ACM Subject Classic ation Computer systems Mob Chain Three Way Collusion Resistance in Witness Oriented Location Proof Systems Using Distributed Consensus Fa he em Za far Abid Khan Saif Ur Rehman Malik de el An um Manso or Ahmed Department of Computer Science COMS AT University Islamabad CUI Islamabad Pakistan Department of Computer Science Aberystwyth University Aberystwyth SY DB United Kingdom Cybernetic AS Tall ann Estonia fa he emi ui gmail com bk aber ac uk saif rehman malik cyber ee de el an um coms at edu pk manso or coms at edu pk Abstract Smart devices have accentuated the importance of geo location information Geo location identification using smart devices has paved the path for incentive based location based services LBS location proof is digital certificate of the geographical location of user which can be used to access various LBS However users full control over device allows the tampering of location proof Initially to resist false proofs two party trusted centralized location proof systems LPS were introduced to aid the users in generating secure location proofs mutually However there were three problems with centralized architecture Firstly LPS must depend on centralized trusted authority Secondly the proposed centralized architectures were too complex to work Thirdly the two party protocols suffered from the collusion attacks by the participants of the protocol Consequently many witness oriented LPS have emerged to mitigate collusion attacks in two party protocols However witness oriented LPS presented the possibility of three way collusion attacks involving the user location authority and the witness The three way collusion attacks are inevitable in all existing witness oriented schemes To mitigate the inability to resist three way collusion of existing schemes in this paper we introduce decentralized consensus protocol called as Mob Chain where the selection of witness and location authority is achieved through distributed consensus of nodes in an underlying network of private block chain The persistent provenance data over the block chain provides strong security guarantees as result the forging and manipulation become impractical Mob Chain provides secure location provenance architecture relying on decentralized decision making for the selection of participants of the protocol to resist three way collusion problem Our prototype implementation and comparison with the state of the art solutions show that Mob Chain is computationally efficient highly available while improving the security of LPS Keywords Location Proofs Location Provenance Three way collusion resistance Block chain Distributed Consensus

On the Server less Nature of Block chains and Smart Contracts Vladimir Yus sup ov Ghare eb Fal zi Uwe Bre it en bu cher Frank Leyman Institute of Architecture of Application Systems University of Stuttgart Germany Abstract Although historically the term server less was also used in the context of peer to peer systems it is more frequently as so cia ted with the architectural style for developing cloud native applications From the developers perspective server less architectures allow reducing management or ts since applications are composed using provider managed components Database as Service DB aS and Function as Service Fa aS oe rings Block chains are distributed systems designed to enable collaborative scenarios involving multiple un trusted parties It seems that the decentralized peer to peer nature of block chains makes it interesting to consider them in server less architectures since resource allocation and management tasks are not required to be performed by users Moreover considering their useful properties of ensuring transactions immutability and facilitating accountable interactions block chains might enhance the overall guarantees and capabilities of server less architectures Therefore in this work we analyze how the block chain technology and smart contracts into the server less picture and derive set of scenarios in which they act as die rent component types in server less architectures Furthermore we formulate the implementation requirements that have to be full led to successfully use block chains and smart contracts in these scenarios Finally we investigate which existing technologies enable these scenarios and analyze their readiness and suitability to full the formulated requirements Keywords Server less Architecture Block chain Smart Contract Function as Service Block chain as Service

block chain mechanism of crypto cur ren cie and its distribution al characteristics In addition to price we emphasise on using actual block size and block time as the operational features of crypto We theory of transaction parallelism in block chains MASSIMO BARTOL ETTI LETTER IO GALL ETTA AND MAURIZIO MUR GIA University of Cagliari Italy mail address bart nica it IMT School for Advanced Studies Lucca Italy mail address letter io gall etta imt lucca it University of Trento Italy mail address maurizio mur gia unit it Abstract Decentralized block chain platforms have enabled the secure exchange of crypto assets without the inter mediation of trusted authorities To this purpose these platforms rely on peer to peer network of byzantine nodes which collaborative ly maintain an append only ledger of transactions called block chain Transactions represent the actions required by users the transfer of some units of crypto currency to another user or the execution of smart contract which distributes crypto assets according to its internal logic Part of the nodes of the peer to peer network compete to append transactions to the block chain To do so they group the transactions sent by users into blocks and up date their view of the block chain state by executing these transactions in the chosen order Once block of transactions is appended to the block chain the other nodes validate it re executing the transactions in the same order The serial execution of transactions does not take advantage of the multi core architecture of modern processors so contributing to limit the throughput In this paper we develop theory of transaction parallelism for block chains which is based on static analysis of transactions and smart contracts Weill us rate how block chain nodes can use our theory to parallel ize the execution of transactions Initial experiments onE there um show that our technique can improve the performance of nodes

VERIFYING LIQUIDITY OF RECURSIVE BITCOIN CONTRACTS MASSIMO BARTOL ETTI STEFANO LANDE MAURIZIO MUR GIA AND ROBERTO ZUNI NO University of Cagliari Italy mail address bart nica it University of Cagliari Italy mail address lande nica it University of Trento Italy mail address maurizio mur gia unit it University of Trento Italy mail address roberto zuni no unit it Abstract Smart contracts computer protocols that regulate the exchange of crypto assets in trust less environments have become popular with the spread of block chain technologies landmark security property of smart contracts is liquidity in an on liquid contract it may happen that some assets remain frozen not redeemable by anyone The relevance of this issue is witnessed by recent liquidity attacks toE there um which have frozen hundreds of USD millions We address the problem of verifying liquidity on Bit ML DSL for smart contracts with secure compiler to Bitcoin featuring primitives for currency transfers contract renegotiation and consensual recursion Our main result is aver cation technique for liquidity We rst transform the in nite state semantics of Bit ML into nite state one which focusses on the behaviour of chosen set of contracts abstracting from the moves of the context With respect to the chosen contracts this abstraction is sound if the abstracted contract is liquid then also the concrete one is such We then verify liquidity by model checking the nite state abstraction We implement tool chain that automatically ve ries liquidity of Bit ML contracts and compiles them to Bitcoin and we assess it through benchmark of representative contracts

Survey on Business Process View Integration Rafael Belch or Sergio Guerre ro Andre Va sconce los and Miguel Correia IN ESC ID Instituto Superior Tec nico December Abstract The complexity of business environment often causes organizations to produce several inconsistent views on the same business process leading to fragment tion and in ec ien cie Business process view integration attempts to produce an integrated view from die rent views of the same model facilitating the man age ment of models To study trends around business process view integration we conduct systematic literature review to summarize dings since the up to its potential novel applications With starting corpus of documents this survey draws up systematic inventory of solutions used in the academia and in the industry By narrowing it down to articles we discuss in depth business process integration techniques papers After that we classify existing solutions according to their practicality Our study shows that most integrated views are constructed by annotation using formal merging rules Finally we explore possible future research directions We highlight the application of view integration to the block chain research area where stake holders can have die rent views on the same block chain We expect that this study contributes to interdisciplinary research across view integration

SURVEY ON PARAMETERIZED VERIFICATION WITH THRESHOLD AUTOMATA AND THE BYZANTINE MODEL CHECKER IGOR KONNO MARIJA NALA ZI ILINA TO ILK OVSK AND JOSEF WI DER Informal Systems Vienna Austria TU Munich Munich Germany TU Wien Informal Systems Vienna Austria Informal Systems Vienna Austria Abstract Threshold guards area basic primitive of many fault tolerant algorithms that solve classical problems of distributed computing such as reliable broadcast two phase commit and consensus Moreover threshold guards can be found in recent block chain algorithms such as Tender mint consensus In this article we give an overview of the techniques implemented in Byzantine Model Checker By MC By MC implements several techniques for automatic ver cation of threshold guarded distributed algorithms These algorithms have the following features up to of processes may crash or behave Byzantine the correct processes count messages and make progress when they receive uci ent ly many messages atleast the number of processes in the system is parameter as well st and the parameters are restricted by resilience condition Traditionally these algorithms were implemented in distributed systems with up toten participating processes Nowadays they are implemented in distributed systems that involve hundreds or thousands of processes To make sure that these algorithms are still correct for that scale it is imperative to verify them for all possible values of the parameters

Security Analysis of Ripple Consensus Ignacio more Se sar Christian Cach in University of Bern University of Bern ignacio more in uni be ch cach in in uni be ch Jovan Mic ic University of Bern jovan mic ic in uni be ch Abstract The Ripple network is one of the most prominent block chain platforms and its native RP token cur rent ly has one of the highest crypto currency market capitalizations The Ripple consensus protocol powers this network and is generally considered to Byzantine fault tolerant agreement protocol which can reach consensus in the presence of faulty or malicious nodes In contrast to traditional Byzantine agreement protocols there is no global knowledge of all participating nodes in Ripple consensus instead each node declares list of other nodes that it trusts and from which it considers votes Previous work has brought up concerns about the live ness and safety of the consensus protocol under the general assumptions stated initially by Ripple and there is currently no appropriate under standing of its workings and its properties in the literature This paper closest his gap and makes two contributions It rst provides detailed abstract description of the protocol which has been derived from the source code Second the paper points out that the abstract protocol may violate safety and live ness in several simple executions under relatively benign network assumptions

Vision Critique of Immunity Passports and Decentralized den tiers Harry Hal pin Leuven ES AT COSI Ka steel park Are nberg Leuven Belgium harry hal pin es at ku leuven be Abstract Due to the widespread OVID pandemic there has been push for immunity passports and even technical proposals Although the debate about the medical and ethical problems of immunity pass ports has been widespread there has been less inspection of the technical foundations of immunity passport schemes These schemes are envisaged to be used for sharing OVID test and vaccination results in gen era The most prominent immunity passport schemes have involved stack of little known standards such as Decentralize dId en tiers DID and Veria ble Credentials VC from the World Wide Web Cons or tiu Our analysis shows that this group of technical identity standards are based on under specie and often non standardized doc um ents that have substantial security and privacy issues due in part to the questionable use of block chain technology One concrete proposal for immunity passports is even susceptible to dictionary attacks The use of cryptography theater in or ts like immunity passports where cryptography is used to allay the privacy concerns of users should be discouraged in standardization Deployment of the seW standards for self sovereign identity in use cases like immunity passports could just as well lead to dangerous form identity totalitarianism Keywords immunity passports Decentralized den tier Veria ble Cr eden ti als security privacy standardization

Block chain Assisted Decentralized Federated Learning BLADE FL with Lazy Clients Jun Li Yu meng Shao Ming Ding Chuan Ma Kang Wei Zhu Han Vincent Poor Nanjing University of Science and Technology Nanjing China Data CSIRO Sydney Australia University of Houston Houston TX USA Princeton University NJ USA jun li shao yu meng chuan ma kang wei just edu cn ming ding data csiro au han zhu gmail com poor princeton edu Abstract Federated learning FL as distributed machine learning approach has drawn great amount of attention in recent years FL shows an inherent advantage in privacy preservation since users raw data are processed locally However it relies on centralized server to perform model aggregation Therefore FL is vulnerable to server malfunctions and external attacks In this paper we propose novel framework by integrating block chain into FL namely block chain assisted decentralized federated learning BLADE FL to enhance the security of FL The proposed BLADE FL has good performance in terms of privacy preservation tamper resistance and effective cooperation of learning However it gives rise to new problem of training dec ien cy caused by lazy clients who plagiarize other strained models and add art ici al noises to conceal their cheating behaviors To be spec ic we rst develop convergence bound of the loss function with the presence of lazy clients and prove that it is convex with respect to the total number of generated blocks Then we solve the convex problem by optimizing to minimize the loss function Furthermore we discover the relationship between the optimal the number of lazy clients and the power of art ici al noises used by lazy clients We conduct extensive experiments to evaluate the performance of the proposed framework using theM NIST and Fashion NIST datasets Our analytical results are shown to be consistent with the experimental results In addition the derived optimal achieves the minimum value of loss function and in turn the optimal accuracy performance

MRs with Block chain distributed democrat is ed Electronic Medical Record sharing platform Sank et She kar Part hit Patel Sap tar shi Maj um der Harsh it Singh shit ija Jag lan and Hr thw ik Sha lu Symbiosis Institute of Technology Pune Savitri bai Ph ule Pune University Pune Indian Institute of Technology Bombay Vive kan and Education Society Institute of Technology Mumbai International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad Indian Institute of Technology Madras Corresponding authors maj um der sap tar shi it ac in smail it ac in ABSTRACT Medical data sharing needs to be done with the utmost respect for privacy and security It contains intimate data of the patient and any access to it must be highly regulated With the emergence of vertical solutions in healthcare institutions interoperability across organisations has been hindered The authors of this paper propose block chain based medical data sharing solution utilising Hyper ledger Fabric to regulate access to medical data and using the Inter Plan tory File System for its storage We believe that the combination of these two distributed solutions can enable patients to access their medical records across healthcare institutions while ensuring non repudiation immutability and providing data ownership It would enable healthcare practitioners to access all previous medical records in single location empowering them with the data required for the effective diagnosis and treatment of patients Making it safe and straightforward it would also enable patients to share medical data with research institutions leading to the creation of reliable datasets laying the groundwork required for the creation of personalised medicine

author Most of Kamal Nasir and Ani chur Rahman ABSTRACT Condominium network refers to intra organization networks where smart buildings or apartments are connected and share resources over the network Secured communication platform or channel has been highlighted as key requirement for reliable condominium which can be ensured by the utilization of the advanced techniques and platforms like Software Defined Network DN Network Function Virtualization NF and Block chain BC These technologies provide robust and secured platform to meet all kinds of challenges such as safety confidentiality flexibility efficiency and availability This work suggests distributed scalable oT DN with Block chain based NF framework for smart condominium Dist Condo that can act as an efficient secured platform for small community Moreover the Block chain based oT DN with NF framework provides the combined benefits of leading technologies It also presents an optimized Cluster Head Selection CH algorithm for selecting Cluster Head CH among the clusters that efficiently saves energy Besides decentralized and secured Block chain approach has been introduced that allows more prominent security and privacy to the desired condominium network Our proposed approach has also the ability to detect attacks in an oT environment Eventually this article evaluates the performance of the proposed architecture using different parameters throughput packet arrival rate and response time The proposed approach outperforms the existing OF Based DN Dist Condo has better throughput on average and the bandwidth Mbps much higher than the OF Based DN approach in the presence of attacks Also the proposed model has an average response time of less than the core model INDEX TERMS oT DN Block chain NF Open Flow Smart Contact Smart Condominium Security Privacy

Abstract We have entered an era where the importance of decentralized solutions has become more obvious Block chain technology and its derivatives are distributed ledger technologies that keep the registry of data between peers of network This ledger is secured within successive over looping cryptographic chain The accomplishment of the Bitcoin crypto currency proved that block chain technology and its derivatives could be used to eliminate intermediaries and provide security for cyberspace However there are some challenges in the implementation of block chain technology This chapter first explains the concept of block chain technology and the data that we can store there in The main advantage of block chain is the security services that it provides This section continues by describing these services The challenges of block chain block chain anomalies energy consumption speed cal ability interoperability privacy and cryptology in the age of quantum computing are described Selected solutions for these challenges are given Remarkable derivatives of block chain which use different solutions directed cyclic graph distributed hash table gossip consensus protocol to solve some of these challenges are described Then the data storage in block chain and evolving data solutions are explained The comparison of decentralized solutions with the centralized database systems is given multi platform interoperable scalable architecture MP IS is proposed In the conclusion we include the evolution assumptions of data storage in decentralized world Keywords Data Data storage Experimental relativistic zero knowledge proofs Pour iy Ali khani Nicolas Brunner Claude Crepe au Sebastien Design ol le Raphael Hou lmann Wei xu Shi and Hugo Zb in den School of Computer Science McGill University Montreal Quebec Canada Department of Applied Physics University of Geneva Gen eve Switzerland Department of Electronic Science National University of Defense Technology Changsha China Dated December Protecting secrets is key challenge in our contemporary information based era In common it at ions however revealing secrets appears unavoidable for instance when identifying oneself in bank to retrieve money In turn this may have highly undesirable consequences in the unlikely yet not unrealistic case where the banks security gets compromised This naturally raises the question of whether disclosing secrets is fundamentally necessary for identifying oneself or more generally for proving statement to be correct Developments in computer science provide an elegant solution via the concept of zero knowledge proofs apr over can convince verier of the validity of certain statement without facilitating the elaboration of proof at all In this work we report the ex per mental realisation of such zero knowledge protocol involving two separated verier pr over pairs Security is enforced via the physical principle of special relativity and no computational assumption such as the existence of one way functions is required Our implementation exclusively relies ono the shelf equipment and works at both short and long distances in about one second This demonstrates the practical potential of multi pr over zero knowledge protocols promising for ident cation tasks and block chain based applications such as crypto currencies or smart contracts

Post Quantum Security of the Bitcoin Backbone and Quantum Multi Solution Bernoulli Search Alexandru Co joca ru Juan Garay gg elo sKi yi as Fang Song Petros Wall den Abstract Bitcoin and its underlying block chain protocol have recently received sign cant attention in the context of building distributed ys tem and foundations of the consensus problem At the same time the rapid development in quantum computing makes the threats to cry to graph more and more concerning In this work we revisit the formal security of the core of the Bitcoin consensus protocol called the Bitcoin backbone Euro crypt in the presence of quantum adversaries adversaries equipped with quantum computers We show that the security of the Bitcoin backbone holds under quan tum analogue of the honest majority assumption that we develop The critical ingredient of proving security of the block chain is to analyzing the quantum query complexity of Chain of Proofs of Work search pro lem This problem in turn reduces to problem we call multi solution Bernoulli search for which we establish its quantum query complexity This can be viewed as an extension of threshold direct product the rem to an average case unstructured search problem Our proof adding to active recent or ts implies and generalizes the powerful recording technique due to Zh an dry Crypto Our analysis indicates that the security of the Bitcoin backbone protocol is guaranteed provided that the number of adversarial quantum queries is bounded so that each quantum query is worth classical ones where is the probability of success of single classical query to the protocols underlying hash function Perhaps surprisingly the wait time for safe settlement of transactions in the case of quantum adversaries matches up to constant the safe settlement time in the classical case and thus does not result in any further overhead

Decentralized Dynamic PKI based on Block chain Mohsen Too rani ID Christian Ge hr mann mohsen too rani it th se christian ge hr mann it th se Department of Electrical and Information Technology Lund University Sweden Abstract The central role of the cert cate authority CA in traditional public key infrastructure PKI makes it fragile and prone to compromises and operational failures Maintaining CAs and revocation lists is demanding especially in loosely connected and large systems Log based PK Is have been proposed as remedy but they do not solve the problem effectively We provide general model and solution for decentralized and dynamic PKI based on block chain and web of trust model where the traditional CA and digital cert cates are removed and instead everything is registered on the block chain Registration revocation and update of public keys are based on consensus mechanism between certain number of entities that are already part of the system Any node which is part of the system can be an auditor and initiate the revocation procedure once it nds out malicious activities Revocation lists are no longer required as any node cane fci ent ly verify the public keys through witnesses

On the Construction of Post Quantum Block chain for Smart City Jia hui Chen Wen sheng Gan Mu chuang Hu Chien Ming Ch end School of Computer Guangdong University of Technology Guangzhou China College of Cyber Security Jinan University Guangzhou China Peoples Bank of China Guangzhou Guangzhou China College of Computer Science and Engineering Shandong University of Science and Technology Qing dao China Abstract Owing to some special characteristics and features block chain is very useful technique that can securely organize diverse devices in smart city It nds wide applications especially in distributed environments where entities such as wireless sensors need to be certain of the authenticity of the server As contemporary block chain techniques that address post quantum concerns have not been designed in this study we in ves tiga tea block chain in the post quantum setting and seek to discover how it can resist attacks from quantum computing In addition traditional proof of work PoW based consensus protocols such as Bitcoin cannot supply memory mining and the transaction capacity of each block in block chain is limited and needs to be expanded Thus new post quantum proof of work post quantum PoW consensus algorithm for security and privacy of smart city applications is proposed It can be used to not only protect block chain under quantum computing attack compared to existing classical hash based PoW algorithms but also to supply memory mining Meanwhile an identity based post quantum signature is embedded into trans ac tion process to construct lightweight transactions Subsequently we provide detailed description on the execution of the post quantum lightweight transaction in block chain Overall this work can help enrich the research on future post quantum block chain and support the construction or architecture of emerging block chain based smart cities Keywords block chain block chain security block chain consensus smart cities post quantum block chain

IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON PARALLEL AND DISTRIBUTED SYSTEMS PoS Making Proof of Stake Decentralized and Fair Muhammad aad Zh an Qin Kui Ren Dae Hun yang and David Moh is en Abstract Block chain applications that rely on the Proof of Work PoW have increasingly become energy in efc ent with staggering carbon footprint In contrast energy efc ent alternative consensus protocols such as Proof of Stake PoS may cause centralization and unfairness in the block chain system To address these challenges we propose modular version of PoS based block chain systems called PoS that resists the centralization of network resources by extending mining opportunities to wider set of stakeholders Moreover PoS leverages the in built system operations to promote fair mining practices by penalizing malicious entities We validate PoS achievable objectives through theoretical analysis and simulations Our results show that PoS ensures fairness and decentralization and can be applied to existing block chain applications Index Terms Block chains Consensus Protocols Bitcoin cid

JOURNAL OF LATEX CLASS FILES VOL XX NO DECEMBER Speeding up Block Propagation in Block chain Network Un coded and Coded Designs Li hao Zhang Tao tao Wang Member IEEE and So ung Chang Lie Fellow IEEE Abstract We design and validate new block propagation protocols for the peer to peer network of the Bitcoin block chain Despite its strong protection for security and privacy the current Bitcoin block chain can only support low number of transactions per second TPS In this work were design the current Bitcoins networking protocol to increase TPS without changing vital components in its consensus building protocol In particular we improve the compact block relaying protocol to enable the propagation of blocks containing massive number of transactions without inducing extra propagation latencies Our improvements consist of replacing the existing store and forward compact block relaying scheme with cut through compact block relaying scheme ii exploiting rate less erasure codes for networks to increase block propagation efc ien cy Since our protocols only need to rework the current Bitcoins networking protocol and does not modify the data structures and crypto functional components they can be seamlessly incorporated into the existing Bitcoin block chain To validate our designs we perform analysis on our protocols and implement Bitcoin network simulator on NS to run different block propagation protocols The analysis and experimental results con rm that our new block propagation protocols could increase the TPS of the Bitcoin block chain by without compromising security and consensus building Index Terms Block chain Networking Protocol Cut through Forwarding Rate less Coding cid

of data When using this technology the farmer can know with whom the supplier for animal feed collaborated with The history of the transactions are not saved in just one place In this way it is more difficult to hack and provide implausible information An learning platform was created where the farm's user can post information respectively new blocks about the animal's birth vaccinations medicines including the location of the livestock The same learning platform is accessible from the mobile phone By using the block chain technology anyone including the client from the shop can know lot about the origin of the products Fake origins of food are much more difficult to hide Fraud is also limited The system monitored the trace ability of dairy products inside Romanian farm Data about fodder provider and quality cow productive performances and health and dairy products process were obtained and analyzed by students who will become specialists at all the levels of the food chain Block chain is the technology which in case of dairy products contamination the origin of the farm is traced in just couple of seconds In this way just batch of dairy products is removed from distribution leading to the reduction of food waste Keywords Block chain food waste farmers learning
