Wisdom of the Crowd Voting Truthful Aggregation of Voter Information and Preferences Grant Schoen beck Bia shuai Tao School of Information John Hop croft Center for Computer Science University of Michigan Shanghai Jiao Tong University schoen eb umich edu bs tao sj tu edu cn Abstract We consider two alternative elections where voters preferences depend on state variable that is not directly observable Each voter receives private signal that is correlated to the state variable Voters may be contingent with die rent preferences in die rent states or predetermined with the same preference in every state In this setting even if every voter is contingent voter agents voting according to their private information need not result in the adoption of the universally preferred alternative because the signals can be systematically biased We present an easy to deploy mechanism that elicits and aggregates the private signals from the voters and outputs the alternative that is favored by the majority In particular voters truthfully reporting their signals forms strong Bayes Nash equilibrium where no coalition of voters can deviate and receive better outcome

Draft version August Typeset using LATEX default style in AS TeX Does detecting water vapors on rocky planets indicate the presence of oceans An insight from self consistent mantle de gassing models Yoshinori Miyazaki and Jun Kore naga Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences Yale University NewHaven CT USA Division of Geological and Planetary Sciences California Institute of Technology Pasadena CA USA Received August Submitted to Astrobiology ABSTRACT uci ent amount of water is required at the surface to develop water oceans but sign cant fraction of water remains in the mantle during magma ocean soli dication Also mantle de gassing during the subsequent period is limited for planets operating under stagnant lid convection The existence of water oceans is therefore not trivial even for exoplanets located in the habitable zone To discuss the likelihood of ocean formation we calculate the rate of mantle de gassing during magma ocean and in the subsequent solid state convection stage We nd that the most important criterion for ocean formation is the ratio of the initial mantle composition and threshold ratio increases with planetary size and net stellar radiation Smaller planets are more likely to develop water oceans because smaller volume of greenhouse gases are emitted to the atmosphere during magma ocean and hydrogen escape would hinder ocean formation for planets receiving stronger radiation Volatile concentrations in the bulk silicate Earth are close to the threshold amount for ocean formation so even with similar volatile compositions to Earth all surface water could exist as vapor and water oceans maybe absent when exoplanets are larger or and receive stronger stellar radiation compared to Earth Despite its di cult in detection smaller exoplanets located further away from the central star may be better candidate to search for potential life Our results also provide plausible explanation for the divergent evolutionary paths of Earth and Venus Keywords habitability magma ocean ocean formation

EXPLORING THE PERSONAL INFORMATICS ANALYSIS GAP THERE LOT OF BACON Jimmy Moore Pascal of Jason Wiese Miri ah Meyer University of Utah As vito Digital AG University of Utah University of Utah jimmy cs utah edu pp goffin gmail com wiese cs utah edu miri ah cs utah edu ABSTRACT Personal informatics research helps people track personal data for the purposes of self re ect ion and gaining self knowledge This el however has predominantly focused on the data collection and insight generation elements of self tracking with less attention paid to ex ble data analysis As result this in attention has led to in ex ble analytic pipelines that do no tree ctor support the diverse ways people want to engage with their data This paper contributes review of personal informatics and visualization research literature to expose gap in our knowledge for designing ex ble tools that assist people engaging with and analyzing personal data in personal contexts what we call the personal informatics analysis gap We explore this gap through multi stage longitudinal study on how asthmatics engage with personal air quality data and were port how participants were motivated by broad and diverse goals exhibited patterns in the way they explored their data engaged with their data in playful ways discovered new insights through serendipitous exploration and were reluctant to use analysis tools on their own These results present new opportunities for visual analysis research and suggest the need for fundamental shifts in how and what we design when supporting personal data analysis Keywords Personal visualization Personal visual analytics Personal informatics Interview methods

The Weighted Average Illusion Biases in Perceived Mean Position in Scatter plots Matt He un Hong Jessica Witt and Danielle Albers zar Member IEEE The mean provides reference for judging If points vary in lightness or size the leading some data points to be data points as above or below average perceived mean position will be biased misjudged as being above average True mean Perceived mean Fig We measured how integrating size or lightness into scatter plots can systematically bias the perceived mean of those points We model how individual marks contribute to this bias allowing us to predict differences in the actual mean blue and where people see the mean orange This misinterpretation can inhibit sense making and decision making For instance points in the grey boxes above will be incorrectly perceived as having higher than average values Under this illusion graph readers mean estimates can be increasingly biased as function of size or lightness ranges mapped on to the data Abstract Scatter plots can encode third dimension by using additional channels like size or color bubble charts We explore potential misinterpretation of tri variate scatter plots which we call the weighted average illusion where locations of larger and darker points are given more weight toward andy mean estimates This systematic bias is sensitive to designers choice of size or lightness ranges mapped on to the data In this paper we quantify this bias against varying size lightness ranges and data correlations We discuss possible explanations for its cause by measuring attention given to individual data points using vision science technique called the centro id method Our work illustrate show ensemble processing mechanisms and mental shortcuts can sign cant ly distort visual summaries of data and can lead to misjudgments like the demonstrated weighted average illusion Index Terms Human Subjects Quantitative Studies Perception Cognition

LENGTH PRESERVING EXTENSIONS OF SEMI MODULAR LATTICES BY LOWERING JOIN IRREDUCIBLE ELEMENTS GABOR ZED LI Abstract We prove that if is join irreducible element of semi modular lattice of nite length and in such that does not cover then can be lowered to covering of by taking length preserving semi mod lar extension of but not changing the rest of join irreducible elements With the help of our lowering construction we prove general theorem on length preserving semi modular extensions of semi modular lattices which im plies some earlier results proved by Gr atze ran dE Kiss Wild and zed li and Schmidt on extensions to geometric lattices and even an unpublished result of Schmidt on higher di men ional rectangular lattices Our method ers shorter proofs of these results than the original ones To obtain the main tool used in the paper we extend the bijective correspondence between nite semi modular lattices and aigle geometries to an analogous correspondence between semi modular lattices of nite lengths and larger class of geometries

Publications of the Astronomical Society of Australia PAS doi pas xxx Observable black hole high mass ray binaries must have Roche lobe ling companions Ryosuke Hirai Ilya Mandel Oz Grav Australian Research Council Centre of Excellence for Gravitational Wave Discovery Clayton VIC Australia Monash Centre for Astrophysics School of Physics and Astronomy Monash University Clayton Victoria Australia Institute of Gravitational Wave Astronomy and School of Physics and Astronomy University of Birmingham Edgbaston Birmingham TT United Kingdom Abstract We explore the eec of anisotropic wind driving on the properties of accretion on to black holes in close binaries We spec ic ally focus on line driven winds which are common in high mass ray binaries In close binary systems the tidal force from the companion star can modify the wind structure in two die rent ways One is the reduction of wind terminal velocity due to the weaker eec ti ve surface gravity The other is the reduction in mass ux due to gravity darkening We incorporate these eec ts into the so called CA theory in simple way and investigate the wind ow around the acc ret or on the orbital scale We nd that focused accretion stream is naturally formed when the Roche lobe ling factor is cid analogous to that of wind Roche lobe over ow but only when the velocity reduction is taken into account The formation of stream is necessary to bring in uci ent angular momentum to form an accretion disc around the black hole Gravity darkening eec ts reduce the amount of ac crete angular momentum but not enough to prevent the formation of disc Based on these results we expect there to be discrete step in the ob ser ability of high mass ray binaries depending on whether the donor Roche lobe ling factor is below or above Keywords stars winds out ow accretion accretion disks rays binaries

solar stellar are In this study we present the investigation of non stationary QP Ps with multiple periods during the impulsive phase of powerful are on September which were si multan ou sly measured by the Large Yield RAdiometer LYRA and the Hard ray Mod ul tion Telescope Insight HX MT as well as the ground based BLE NSW The multiple periods detected by applying wavelet transform and Lom Scar le period ogram to the de trended light curves are found to be in the Ly and mid ultraviolet Xi Balmer continuum emissions during the are impulsive phase Similar QP Ps with multi ple periods are also found in the hard ray emission and low frequency radio emission Our observations suggest that the are QP Ps could be related to non thermal electrons accelerated by the repeated energy release process triggering of repetitive magnetic re connection while the multiple periods might be modulated by the sausage oscillation of hot plasma loops For the multi periodic pulsations other generation mechanisms could not be completely ruled out Subject headings Solar are Solar oscillations Solar ultraviolet emission Solar ray emission Solar radio emission Correspondence should be sent to li dong pm ac cn

Lucia QLD Australia Centre for Astrophysics University of Southern Queensland West Street Toowoomba QLD Australia Received Revised Accepted Submitted to ABSTRACT We search for transits around all known pulsating ct variables Te in the long cadence Kepler data after subtracting the pulsation signal through an automated routine To achieve this we devise simple and computationally inexpensive method for distinguishing between low frequency pulsations and transits in lightcurves Wend new candidate transit events that were previously hidden behind the pulsations but caution that they are likely to be false positive events We also examined the Kepler Objects of Interest catalog and identify additional host stars which show ct pulsations For each star in our sample we use the non detection of pulsation timing variations for planet that is known to be transiting ct variable to obtain both an upper limit on the mass of the planet and the expected radial velocity semi amplitude of the host star Simple injection tests of our pipeline imply recovery for planets of or greater Extrapolating our number up of Kepler ct stars we expect detectable planets above in TESS Our sample contains up some of the hottest known transiting planets around evolved stars and is the rst complete sample of transits around ct variables We make available our code and pulsation subtracted light curves to facilitate further analysis cid

Research on Third Party Libraries in Android Apps Taxonomy and Systematic Literature Review Xian Zh an Tian ming Liu Ling ling Fan Li Li Sen Chen Xi apu Luo and Yang Liu Abstract Third party libraries TPL have been widely used in mobile apps which play an essential part in the entire Android ecosystem However TPL is double edged sword On the one hand it can ease the development of mobile apps On the other hand it also brings security risks such as privacy leaks or increased attack surfaces by introducing over privileged permissions to mobile apps Although there are already many studies for characterizing third party libraries including automated detection security and privacy analysis of TPL TPL attributes analysis etc what strikes us odd is that there is no systematic study to summarize those studies endeavors To this end we conduct the rst systematic literature review on Android TPL related research Following well de ned systematic literature review protocol we collected primary research papers closely related to Android third party library from to After carefully examining these studies we designed taxonomy of TPL related research studies and conducted systematic study to summarize current solutions limitations challenges and possible implications of new research directions related to third party library analysis We hope that these contributions can give readers clear overview of existing TPL related studies and inspire them togo beyond the current status quo by advancing the discipline with innovative approaches Index Terms Third party library Android Literature review Applications cid

context volume rendered together showing the rendering of the thick inter lob lar sept ation pink surface like structure in the right lung Abstract Sign cant work has been done towards deep learning DL models for automatic lung and lesion segmentation and classic ation of OVID on chest CT data However comprehensive visualization systems focused on supporting the dual visual DL diagnosis of OVID are non existent We present OVID view visualization application specially tailored for radiologists to diagnose OVID from chest CT data The system incorporates complete pipeline of automatic lungs segmentation local iz tion isolation of lung abnormalities followed by visualization visual and DL analysis and measurement quant cation tools Our system combines the traditional work ow of radiologists with newer and visualization techniques with DL support for more comprehensive diagnosis OVID view incorporates novel DL model for classifying the patients into positive negative OVID cases which acts as reading aid for the radiologist using OVID view and provides the attention heat map as an explain able DL for the model output We designed and evaluated OVID view through suggestions close feedback and conducting case studies of real world patient data by expert radiologists who have substantial experience diagnosing chest CT scans for OVID pulmonary embolism and other patient cases Index Terms Visual deep learning diagnosis OVID chest CT volume rendering IP classic ation model explain able DL

Mis spoke or mis lead Achieving Robustness in Multi Agent Communicative Reinforcement Learning Wan qi Xue Wei Qi Nanyang Technological University Nanyang Technological University wan qi ntu edu sg qi uw ntu edu sg Bo An Zi novi Rabi no vich Nanyang Technological University Nanyang Technological University bo an ntu edu sg zi novi ntu edu sg Svetlana Ob raz ts ova Ch aiKi at Yeo Nanyang Technological University Nanyang Technological University lana ntu edu sg as ck yeo ntu edu sg Abstract Recent studies in multi agent communicative reinforcement learning MAC RL demonstrate that multi agent coordination can be sign cant ly improved when communication between agents is allowed Meanwhile advances in adversarial machine learning ML have shown that ML and reinforcement learning RL mod els are vulnerable to variety of attacks that sign cant ly degrade the performance of learned behaviours However despite the obvious and growing importance the combination of adversarial ML and MAC RL remains largely un investigated In this paper we make the rst step towards conducting message attacks on MAC RL methods In our formulation one agent in the cooperating group is taken over by an adversary and can send malicious messages to disrupt deployed MAC RL based coordinated strategy during the deployment phase We further our study by developing defence method via message reconstruction Finally we address the resulting arms race we consider the ability of the malicious agent to adapt to the changing and improving defensive communicative policies of the benign agents Spec ic ally we model the adversarial MAC RL problem as two player zero sum game and then utilize Policy Space Response Oracle to achieve communication robustness Empirically we demonstrate that MAC RL methods are vulnerable to message attacks while our defence method the game theoretic framework can effectively improve the robustness of MAC RL

Model free online motion adaptation for energy efc ent ig ht of multi copters Xiang yu Wu Jun Zeng Andrea Tag li abu and Mark Mueller Abstract Limited ig ht distance and time is common problem for multi copters We propose method for ding the optimal speed and heading of multi copters while ying given path to achieve the longest ig ht distance or time Since ig ht speed and heading are often free variables in multi copter path planning they can be changed without changing the mission The proposed method is based on novel multivariable ex tre mum seeking controller with adaptive step size It does not require any power consumption model of the vehicle can be executed online is computationally efc ent and runs on low cost embedded computers in real time and converges faster than the standard ex tre mum seeking controller with constant step size We prove the stability of this proposed ex tre mum seeking controller and conduct outdoor experiments to validate the effectiveness of this method with different initial conditions with and without payload This method could be especially useful for applications such as package delivery where the weight size and shape of the payload vary between deliveries and the power consumption of the vehicle is hard to model Experiments show that compared to ying at the maximum speed with bad heading angle ying at the optimal range speed and heading reduces the energy consumed per distance by without payload and with box payload In addition compared to hovering ying at the optimal endurance speed and heading Figure quad copter carrying payloads with differing mass and aero dy reduces the the power consumption by without payload nam ics properties as used in our experiments and with box payload motors Hybrid quad copters which are able to do both aerial

Mean exit time in annular heterogeneous media Elliot Carr Daniel Vanden He vel Joshua Wilson and Matthew Simpson School of Mathematical Sciences Queensland University of Technology Brisbane Queensland Australia Abstract Calculating the mean exit time MET for models of diu sion is classical problem in statistical physics with various applications in biophysics economics and heat and mass transfer While many exact results for MET are known for diu sion in simple geometries involving homogeneous materials calculating MET for diu sion in realistic geometries in vol ving heterogeneous materials is typically limited to repeated stochastic simulations or numerical solutions of the associated boundary value problem VP In this work we de rive exact solutions for the MET in irregular annular domains including some applications where diu sion occurs in he erogenous media These solutions are obtained by taking the exact results for MET in an annul us and then constructing various perturbation solutions to account for the irregular geometries involved These solutions with range of bound ary conditions are implemented symbolically and compare very well with averaged data from repeated stochastic simulations and with numerical solutions of the associated VP Software to implement the exact solutions is available on it Hub Keywords Random walk Hitting time Passage time Perturbation

Time Frequency Localization Using Deep Convolutional Max out Neural Network in Persian Speech Recognition rash De hg hani Seyyed Ali Seyyed saleh Faculty of Biomedical Engineering Amir kabir University of Technology Tehran Polytechnic Hafez Ave Tehran Iran rash de hg hani saleh aut ac ir In this paper CNN based structure for time frequency localization of audio signal information in the AS acoustic model is proposed for Persian speech recognition Research has shown that the receptive fields time frequency flexibility in some mammals auditory neurons system improves recognition performance Bio systems have inspired many artificial systems because of their high efficiency and performance so time frequency localization has been used extensively to improve system performance In the last few years much work has been done to localize time frequency information in AS systems which has used the spatial immutability properties of methods such as TD NN CNN and STM RN However most of these models have large parameter volumes and are challenging to train In the structure we have designed called Time Frequency Convolutional Max out Neural Network FC MN two parallel blocks consisting of CM NN each have weight sharing in one dimension are applied simultaneously but independently to the feature vectors Then their output is concatenated and applied to fully connected Max out network for classification To improve the performance of this structure we have used newly developed methods and models such as the max out Dropout and weight normalization Two experimental sets were designed and implemented on the Persian FARS DAT speech data set to evaluate the performance of this model compared to conventional CM NN models According to the experimental results the average recognition score of FC MN models is about higher than the average of conventional models In addition the average training time of the FC MN models is about hours lower than the average training time of traditional models As result as mentioned in other references time frequency localization in AS systems increases system accuracy and speeds up the model training process Key Words Time Frequency Localization Artificial Neural Networks Convolutional Neural Networks Speech Recognition Max out Dropout FARS DAT

Effectiveness of regional diffusion MRI measures in distinguishing multiple sclerosis abnormalities within the cervical spinal cord Hayk elS nous sia Julien Cohen Adad Be not Combs lise Bann era Slim neTo nek tid Anne Ker rate Christian Bari lot Emmanuel Ca ruy era aU niv Rennes CNRS In ria In erm IRIS AU MR Em pennER LU Rennes France Neuro Poly Lab Institute of Biomedical Engineering Polytechnique Montreal Montreal Canada Department of Radiology Rennes University Hospital Rennes France Department of Radiology Thomas Jefferson University Philadelphia PA USA Departement of Neurology Rennes University Hospital Rennes France Abstract Multiple sclerosis is an in amma tory disorder of the central nervous system Quantitative MRI has huge potential to provide intrinsic and normative values of tissue properties useful for diagnosis prognosis and ultimately clinical follow up of this disease However there is large discrepancy between the clinical observations and how the pathology is exhibited in MRI brain scans Complementary to brain imaging the study of multiple sclerosis lesions in the spinal cord has recently gained interest as potential marker for early physical impairment Therefore investigating how the spinal cord is damaged using quantitative imaging in particular diffusion MRI becomes an acute challenge In this work we extract average diffusion MRI metrics per vertebral level from spinal cord data acquired from multiple clinical sites The diffusion based metrics involved are extracted from the diffusion tensor imaging and Ball and Stick models and quan tied for every cervical vertebral level using collection of image processing methods and an atlas based approach Then we perform statistical analysis study to characterize the feasibility of these metrics to detect lesions Spec ic ally we study the usefulness of combining different metrics to improve the accuracy prediction score associated with the presence of multiple sclerosis lesions We demonstrate the grade of sensitivity to underlying micro structure changes in MS patients of each metric Ball and Stick provides novel information about theM damage to tissue micro structure In addition we show that choosing subset of metrics FA RD MD and WW MD Stick AD RD which bring complementary information has sign cant ly increased the prediction score of the presence of theM lesion in the cervical spinal cord Keywords Diffusion MRI Statistical Analysis Spinal Cord Multiple Sclerosis

THE MYSTERIES OF THE BEST APPROXIMATION AND CHEBYSHEV EXPANSION FOR THE FUNCTION WITH LOGARITHM TIC REGULARITIES XIAO LONG ZHANG Abstract The best polynomial approximation and Chebyshev approximation are both important in numerical an aly is In tradition the best approximation is regarded as more better than the Chebyshev approximation because it is usually considered in the uniform norm However it not always superior to the latter noticed by Tre fe then for the algebraic singularity function Recently Wang have proved it in theory In this paper we nd that for the functions with logarithmic regularities the point wise errors of Chebyshev approximation are smaller than the errors of the best approximations except only in the very narrow boundaries The point wise error for Chebyshev series truncated at the de green isO min but is worse by one power of in narrow boundary layer near the endpoints Keywords Chebyshev projection Endpoint singularities Steepest Descent Method Best approximation Chebyshev interpolation AMS subject classic at ions

Online Multi objective Mini max Optimization and Applications Georgy No aro Malle sh Pai Aaron Roth August Abstract We introduce simple but general online learning framework in which at every round an adaptive adversary introduces new game consisting of an action space for the learner an action space for the adversary and vector valued objective function that is convex concave in every coordinate The learner and the adversary then play in this game The learners goal is to play so as to minimize the maximum coordinate of the cumulative vector valued loss The resulting one shot game is not convex concave and so the mini max theorem does not apply Nevertheless we give simple algorithm that can compete with the setting in which the adversary must announce their action rst with optimal ly diminishing regret We demonstrate the power of our simple framework by using it to derive optimal bounds and algorithms across variety of domains This includes no regret learning we can recover optimal algorithms and bounds for minimizing external regret internal regret adaptive regret multi group regret sub sequence regret and notion of regret in the sleeping experts setting Next we use it to derive variant of Blackwell Approach ability Theorem which we term Fast Polytope Approach ability Finally we are able to recover recently derived algorithms and bounds for online adversarial multi calibration and related notions mean conditioned moment multi calibration and prediction interval multi validity

High temporal resolution total body dynamic PET CT imaging based on third order Hermit interpolation Zi xiang Chen Ya ping Wu Na Zhang Yu Shen Chen wei Li Yong feng Yang in Liu Hair ong Zheng Dong Liang Mei yun Wang and Zh an li Hu Lauter bur Research Center for Biomedical Imaging Shenzhen Institute of advanced technology Chinese academy of science Shenzhen China Chinese Academy of Sciences Key Laboratory of Health Informatics Shenzhen China Department of Medical Imaging Henan Provincial Peoples Hospital Peoples Hospital of Zhengzhou University Zhengzhou China Central Research Institute Shanghai United Imaging Healthcare Shanghai China These authors contributed equally Author to whom any correspondence should be addressed Email zl hu si at ac cn Abstract Dynamic positron emission tomography PET is currently widely used medical imaging technique for the clinical diagnosis staging and therapy guidance of all kinds of human cancers Higher temporal imaging resolution for the early stage of radio tracer metabolism is desired however in this case the reconstructed images with short frame durations always suffer from limited image signal to noise ratio SNR which results in unsatisfactory image spatial resolution In this work we proposed PET processing method that de noises images with short frame durations via pixel level time activity curve TAC correction based on third order Hermit interpolation Pitch In The proposed method was validated using total body dynamic PET image data and compared to several state of the art methods to demonstrate its superior performance in terms of high temporal resolution PET image noise reduction and imaging contrast Higher stability and feasibility of the proposed Pitch In method for future clinical application with high temporal resolution TR PET imaging can be expected Keywords Dynamic PET imaging Temporal resolution Image de noising TAC correction Third order Hermit interpolation

be able to accelerate cosmic rays only up to eV at their present evolutionary stages recent studies have shown that particle energies larger than few Pe eV could be reached during the early stages of core collapse Supernova when the high velocity forward shock expands into the dense circumstellar medium shaped by the stellar progenitor wind Such environments in particular the type In Ne whose progenitors may exhibit mass loss rates as high as cid yr could thus lead to ray emission from decay in hadron ic interactions potentially detectable with current Cherenkov telescopes at very high energies Such detection would provide direct evidence fore cie nt acceleration of CR protons nuclei in supernovae and hence new insights on the long standing issue of the origin of Galactic Cosmic Rays In that context the High Energy Stereoscopic System has been carrying out Target of Opportunity program since to search for such an early very high energy ray emission towards nearby core collapse supernovae and supernova candidates up to Mpc within few weeks after discovery After giving an overview of this Target of Opportunity program we present the results obtained from the July Dynamical Systems Theory compared to Game Theory The case of the Salamis battle Konstantin Fount Lou as Za chilas Dept of Economics University of Thessaly Volos Greece Email fount th gr za chilas th gr Abstract In this paper we present an innovative nonlinear discrete dynamical system trying to model the historic battle of Salamis between Greeks and Persians September marks the anniversary for the years that have passed since this famous naval battle which took place in late September The suggested model describes very well the most effective strategic behavior between two participants during battle or in war Moreover we compare the results of the Dynamical Systems analysis to Game Theory considering this conflict as war game Keywords Discrete Dynamical Systems Modeling Strategic Behavior Game Theory Battle of Salamis

ABSTRACT Context The detection of Earth mass exoplanets in the habitable zone around solar mass stars using the radial velocity technique requires extremely high precision on the order of cms This puts the required noise or below the intrinsic variability of even relatively inactive stars such as the Sun One such variable is convective blue shift varying temporally spatially and between spectral lines Aims We develop new approach for measuring convective blue shift and determine the strength of convective blue shift for stars observed by the HARPS spectrograph spanning spectral types late and early We derive model for in fe ring blue shift velocity for lines of any depth in later type stars of any eec ti ve temperature Methods Using custom list of spectral lines covering wide range of absorption depths we create model for the line core shift as function of line depth commonly known as the third signature of granulation For this we utilize an extremely high resolution solar spectrum to empirically account for the nonlinear nature of the third signature The solar third signature is then scaled to all stars Through this we obtain measure of the convective blue shift relative to the Sun as function of stellar eec ti ve temperature Results Wec on rm the general correlation of increasing convective blue shift with eec ti ve temperature and establish tight cubic relation between the two that strongly increases for stars above For stars between and we show for the rst time plateau in convective shift and possible onset of plateau for stars above Stars below shown either blue shift nor redshift We provide table that lists expected blue shift velocities for each spectral subtype in the data set to quickly access the intrinsic noise or through convective blue shift for the radial velocity technique Keywords Convection Techniques radial velocities Sun granulation Stars activity

Numerical method to characterise capsule membrane permeability for controlled drug delivery Clement Biel in ski and Badr Ka oui Bio mechanics and Bioengineering Laboratory Universit de Techno logie de Compi gne CNRS Compi gne France Dated August Design and character is ation of capsules is not an easy task owing to the multiple involved prep ration factors and parameters Here novel method to characterise capsule membrane permeability to solute molecules by an inverse approach is proposed Transport of chemical species between the capsule core and the surrounding medium through the membrane is described by the Fic ks second law with position dependent diu sion coe cie nt Solutions are computed in spherical coordinates using nite die rence scheme developed for diu sion in multilayer cong ration They are vali dated using semi analytical solutions and fully three dimensional lattice Bolt mann simulations As proof of concept the method is applied to experimental data available in the literature on the kinetics of glucose release and absorption to determine the membrane permeability of capsules The proposed method is easy to use and determines correctly the permeability of capsule membranes for controlled drug release and absorption applications Keywords Controlled release absorption capsules membrane permeability computer simulations

Deterministic one way logic gates on cloud quantum computer Zhi Peng Yang lakes Bai shy Huan Yu Ku Yu Ran Zhang Anton Frisk Ko kum Yue Nan Chen Fu Li Li Jaw Shen Tsai and Franco Nori Ministry of Education Key Laboratory for Non equilibrium Synthesis and Modulation of Condensed Matter Shaanxi Province Key Laboratory of Quantum Information and Quantum Op to electronic Devices School of Science Xian Jiao tong University Xian Shann xi China Theoretical Quantum Physics Laboratory RIKEN Cluster for Pioneering Research Wako shi Saitama Japan Department of Physics and Center for Quantum Frontiers of Research Technology Fort National Cheng Kung University Tainan Taiwan Department of Micro technology and Nano science Chalmers University of Technology Gothenburg Sweden Department of Physics Tokyo University of Science Shinjuku Tokyo Japan Superconducting Quantum Simulation Research Team RIKEN Center for Quantum Computing Wako Saitama Japan Quantum Information Physics Theory Research Team RIKEN Center for Quantum Computing Wako Saitama Japan Department of Physics The University of Michigan Ann Arbor Michigan USA Dated August One way quantum computing is promising candidate for fault tolerant quantum computing Here we propose new protocols to realize deterministic one way NOT gate and one way rotations on quantum computing platforms By applying delayed choice scheme we overcome limit of most currently available quantum computers which are unable to implement further operations on measured qu bits or operations conditioned on measurement results from other qu bits Moreover we decrease the error rate of the one way logic gates compared to the original protocol using local operations and classical communication LOC In addition we apply our deterministic one way NOT gate in the Deutsch Jo zsa algorithm to show the feasibility of our proposal We demonstrate all these one way gates and algorithms by running experiments on the cloud quantum computing platform IBM Quantum Experience

Adaptive Anomaly Detection for Internet of Things in Hierarchical Edge Computing Contextual Band it Approach MAO NGO Singapore University of Technology and Design Singapore TIE LUO Missouri University of Science and Technology USA TONY QUE Singapore University of Technology and Design Singapore The advances in deep neural networks NN have significantly enhanced real time detection of anomalous data in oT applications However the complexity accuracy delay dilemma persists complex NN models offer higher accuracy but typical oT devices can barely afford the computation load and the remedy of off loading the load to the cloud incurs long delay In this paper we address this challenge by proposing an adaptive anomaly detection scheme with hierarchical edge computing HE Specifically we first construct multiple anomaly detection NN models with increasing complexity and associate each of them to corresponding HE layer Then we design an adaptive models election scheme that is formulated as contextual band it problem and solved by using reinforcement learning policy network We also incorporate parallelism policy training method to accelerate the training process by taking advantage of distributed models We build an HE test bed using real oT devices implement and evaluate our contextual band it approach with both uni variate and multivariate oT datasets In comparison with both baseline and state of the art schemes our adaptive approach strikes the best accuracy delay tradeoff on the uni variate data set and achieves the best accuracy and score on the multivariate data set with only negligibly longer delay than the best but inflexible scheme CCS Concepts Computer systems organization tier architectures Sensor networks Computing methodologies Intelligent agents Additional KeyWords and Phrases Internet of things anomaly detection hierarchical edge computing reinforcement learning auto encoder STM

Significantly enhanced polymer thermal conductivity by confining effect through bilayer MoS Surfaces Mohammad Reza Ghar ib Zahedi Amin Koo chaki Mohammad lag he man dic Department of Chemistry Sharif University of Technology Tehran Iran Department of Chemical Sciences and Bernal Institute University of Limerick Limerick PX Republic of Ireland Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering and BU Photo nics Center Boston University Boston MA USA Abstract The present work refers to simulation study on nano confined polymers in polymer MoS nano composites as function of MoS MoS inter layer separation We indeed apply reverse none quli rium molecular dynamics simulations RNE MD to investigate thermal conductivity of polyamide oli gomer which is confined by MoS bilayer The polymer thermal conductivity can be considerably enhanced when polymer chains are confined by MoS sheets in particular such behavior is more obvious for charged surfaces The presence of the MoS surfaces leads to well ordering of polymer chains as well as denser packing which is an increase in in the polymer network via the use of MoS surface confinement Polymer chains elongation as well as their preferential alignment parallel to the MoS surfaces indicates that in the polymer domain of the considered nano composites is larger than the one in the pure polymer phase Additionally our results of number of hydrogen bonds HBs in confined polymer chains suggest that combined effect of the mentioned structural modification and enlarged values of HBs may cooperatively contribute to high polymer thermal conductivity facilitating ph on on transport Results reported here suggest significant manner to design of confined polymer MoS composites for wide variety range of applications Keywords Reverse non equilibrium molecular dynamic thermal conductivity confined polymer MoS surfaces Correspondence should be addressed ghar ib zahedi gmail com

radiation pressure from asteroid egoli th AR acting on small dust particles over the surface of the AR In particular we aim to understand the role of thermal radiation in the near Sun environment gravitational el Mie theory is used because the particles of interest have sizes comparable to thermal wavelengths and thus the geometric approximation is not applicable new set of formalism is developed for the purpose Results Wend that the acceleration of particles with spherical radius cid to mis dominated by the thermal radiation from the AR when the asteroid is in the near Sun environment heliocentric distance cid au Under thermal radiation dominance the net acceleration is towards space that is outwards from the AR This outward acceleration is the strongest for particles of min radius regardless of other parameters preliminary trajectory integration using the Phaethon like model shows that such particles escape from the gravitational el within about minutes Our results are consistent with the previous observational studies on Phaethon in that the ejected dust particles have spherical radius of Keywords Minor planets asteroids general Minor planets asteroids individual Phaethon

August Super twist or realisation of AdS super spaces Sergei Ku zen koa and Gabriele Tart agli no Maz zu chell ib Department of Physics The University of Western Australia Stirling Highway Perth Australia School of Mathematics and Physics University of Queensland St Lucia Brisbane Queensland Australia sergei ku zen ko uwa edu au tart agli no maz zu chell edu au Abstract We propose super twist or realisation of anti de Sitter AdS super spaces in three dimensions and extended AdS super spaces in four dimensions For each super space we identify two point function that is invariant under the correspond in gi some try supergroup This two point function is supersymmetric extension of function of the geodesic distance We also describe bi super twist or formulation for extended AdS super space in four dimensions

Chinese Academy of Sciences Lan zhou China Lan zhou University Lan zhou China Department of Modern Physics University of Science and Technology of China He fei China Department of Physics and Astronomy Iowa State University Ames Iowa USA Dated August We produce the light front wave functions FW Fs of the nucleon from basis light front ap roach in the leading Fock sector representation We solve for the masse gen states from light front eec ti ve Hamiltonian which includes conning potential adopted from light front holography in the transverse direction longitudinal conn ment and one gluon exchange interaction with ed coupling We then employ the FW Fs to obtain the electromagnetic and axial form factors the par ton distribution functions PDFs and the generalized part on distribution functions for the nucleon The electromagnetic and axial form factors of the proton agree with the experimental data whereas the neutron form factors deviate somewhat from the experiments in the low momentum transfer region The un polarized the he li city and the trans vers it valence quark PDFs after QCD scale evolution are fairly consistent with the global ts to the data at the relevant experimental scales The he li city asymmetry for the down quark also agrees well with the measurements however the asymmetry for the up quark shows deviation from the data especially in the small region We also nd that the tensor charge agrees well with the extracted data and the lattice QCD predictions while the axial charge is somewhat outside the experimental error bar The electromagnetic radii of the proton the magnetic radius of the neutron and the axial radius are in excellent agreement with the measurements while the neutron charge radius deviates from experiment

Agricultural Growth Diagnostics Identifying the Binding Constraints and Policy Remedies for Bihar India El malai Kann an Associate Professor Centre for the Study of Regional Development School of Social Sciences Jawaharlal Nehru University JNU New Delhi Email el malai mail jnu ac in Sanji Poh it Professor National Council of Applied Economic Research CAER New Delhi Email poh it caer org Abstract Agriculture plays significant role in economic development of the underdeveloped region Multiple factors influence the performance of agricultural sector but few of these have strong bearing on its growth We develop growth diagnostics framework for agricultural sector in Bihar located in eastern India to identify the most binding constraints Our results show that poor functioning of agricultural markets and low level of crop diversification are the important reasons for lower agricultural growth in Bihar Rise in the level of instability in the prices of agricultural produces indicates weak price transmission across the markets even after repealing the agricultural produce market committee act Poor market linkages and non functioning producer collectives at village level affect the farmers motivation for undertaking crop diversification Our policy suggestions include state provision of basic market infrastructure to attract private investment in agricultural marketing strengthening the farmer producer organisations and comprehensive policy on crop diversification Keywords agriculture growth diagnostics binding constraints agricultural markets Disclaimer The findings interpretations and conclusions expressed are those of the authors and do not necessarily reflect the views of the Governing Body or Management of CAER This paper is the outcome of the report which has been commissioned by South Asia Research Hub Department for International Development Government of UK However the views expressed do not necessarily reflect the UK Governments official policies

ZZZ ABSTRACT The intrinsic alignments of galaxies the correlation between galaxy shapes and their environment are major source of contamination for weak gravitational lensing surveys Most studies of intrinsic alignments have so far focused on measuring and modelling the correlations of luminous red galaxies with galaxy positions or the laments of the cosmic web In this work we investigate alignments around cosmic voids We measure the intrinsic alignments of luminous red galaxies detected by the Sloan Digital Sky Survey around sample of voids constructed from those same tracers and with radii in the ranges Mpc and in the redshift range We present ts to the measurements based on linear model at large scales and on new model based on the void density role inside the void and in its neighbourhood We constrain the free scaling amplitude of our model at small scales ding no sign cant alignment at for either sample We observe deviation from the null hypothesis at large scales of for voids with radii between and Mpc and for voids with radii between and Mpc and constrain the amplitude of the model on these scales Wend no sign cant deviation at for larger voids Our work is rst attempt at detecting intrinsic alignments around voids and provides useful framework for their mitigation in future void lensing studies Keywords gravitational lensing weak methods data analysis galaxies statistics large scale structure of Universe

Quantum single photon control storage and entanglement generation with planar atomic arrays Ballantine and Ru ost ko ski Department of Physics Lancaster University Lancaster LA YB United Kingdom Dated August We theoretically demonstrate how to achieve quantum control of an incident single photon pulse by engineering the collective response of two dimensional atomic array High del it absorption and storage in along lived sub radiant state and its subsequent retrieval are achieved by controlling classically or quantum mechanically the ac Stark shifts of the atomic levels and suppressing the scattering during the absorption Quantum wavefront control of the transmitted photon with nearly zero re ect ionis prepared by coupling the collective state of the array to another photon in cavity and by engineering Huygens surface of atoms only by single coherent standing wave The proposed schemes allow for the generation of entanglement between the cavity the lattice and hence the state of the stored ree ted or transmitted light and for quantum state transfer between the cavity and propagating photons We illustrate the control by manipulating the phase phase superposition polarization and direction of transmitted orr eec ted photon providing quantum optical switches and functional quantum interfaces between light and atoms that could form links in larger quantum information platform

DK Quantum Markov Chains on the Comb graphs Ising model Far rukh Muk ham edo Department of Mathematical Sciences College of Science United Arab Emirates University Al in United Arab Emirates mail far gmail com far rukh uae ac Abd ess atar So is si Department of Accounting College of Business Management Qassim University Ar Rass Saudi Arabia and Preparatory institute for sci en tic and technical studies Carthage University Amil car Tunisia mail so is si qu edu ab des sattar so is si pest rn tn are Ham di Department of Management Information Systems College of Business Management Qassim University Ar Rass Saudi Arabia and Labor to ire Analyse Ma the mati ques et applications LR ES Universit de Tunis El Man ar Tunisia mail ham di qu edu Abstract In the present paper we construct quantum Markov chains QM over the Comb graphs As an application of this construction it is proved the existence of the disordered phase for the Ising type models within QM scheme over the Comb graphs Moreover it is also established that the associated QM has clustering property with respect to translations of the graph We stress that this paper is the rst one where nontrivial example of QM over non regular graphs is given Mathematics Subject Classic ation Key words quantum Markov chain Ising model Comb graph clustering

MAXIMIZING VORTEX FOR THE NAVIER STOKES FLOW WITH CONVECTIVE BOUNDARY CONDITION SHAPE DESIGN PROBLEM JOHN SEBASTIAN SIMON AND HIRO FU MINOT SU Abstract In this study shape optimization problem for the two dimensional stationary Navier Stokes equations with an art ici al boundary condition is considered The id is assumed to be owing through rectangular channel and the art ici al boundary condition is formulated so as to take into account the possibility of ill posed ness caused by the usual do nothing boundary condition The goal of the optimization problem is to maximize the vorticity of the saidu id by determining the shape of an obstacle inside the channel Meanwhile the shape variation is limited by perimeter functional and volume constraint The perimeter functional was considered to act as Tikhon ov regularize and the volume constraint is added to exempt us from topological changes in the domain The shape derivative of the objective functional was formulated using the rearrangement method and this derivative was later on used for gradient descent methods Additionally an augmented Lagrangian method and class of solenoid al deformation lds were considered to take into account the goal of volume preservation Lastly numerical examples based on the gradient descent and the volume preservation methods are presented

Deep Learning Searches for Vector Like Leptons at the LHC and Electron Muon Collider Ant nio Morais Ant nio Onofre Felipe Freitas Joo Gon alves Roman Pas ech nik and Rui Santos Depart men to de sica da Universidade de Ave ro Ave ro Portugal Centre for Research and Development in Mathematics and Applications CID MA Ave ro Portugal Depart men to de sica da Universidade do Minho Braga Portugal Department of Astronomy and Theoretical Physics Lund University Sl vega tan SE Lund Sweden Centro de sica erica Com put ac ional acul dade de in cias Universidade de Lisboa Lisboa Portugal IS EL Instituto Superior de En gen hari de Lisboa Instituto Polit nico de Lisboa Lisboa Portugal Centro de sica erica Com put ac ional acul dade de in cias Universidade de Lisboa Campo Grande Edif cio Lisboa Portugal The discovery potential of both single and doublet vector like leptons LL at the Large Hadron Collider LHC as well as at the not so far future muon and electron machines is explored The focus is on single production channel for LHC direct searches while double production signatures are proposed for the lepton ic collider Implications for the discovery of LL in view of the recently announced muon anomaly are also discussed Deep Learning algorithm to determine the discovery or exclusion statistical sign can ce at the LHC is employed While doublet LL can be probed up to masses of TeV their single counterparts have very low cross sections and can hardly be tested beyond few hundreds of GeV at the LHC This motivates physics case analysis in the context of lepton ic collider where one obtains larger cross sections in LL double production channels allowing to probe higher mass regimes otherwise inaccessible even to the LHC high luminosity upgrade aap morais pt onofre sica minho pt felipe freitas pt pedro pino pt Roman Pas ech nik the lu se ra santos fc ul pt

Testing density functional theory in quantum Ising chain Jia hao Mao Hai feng Tang Wen hui Duan and Zheng Liu State Key Laboratory of Low Dimensional Quantum Physics Department of Physics Tsinghua University Beijing China Institute for Advanced Study Tsinghua University Beijing China By using the quantum Ising chain as test bed and treating the spin polarization along the external transverse el das the generalized density we examine the performance of die rent levels of density functional approximations parallel to those widely used for interacting electrons such as local density approximation LDA and generalized gradient approximation GG We show that by adding the lowest order and nearest neighbor density variation correction to the simple LDA semi local energy functional in the spirit of GG is almost exact over wide range of in homogeneous density distribution In addition the LDA and GG error structures bear high level of resemblance to the quantum phase diagram of the system These results provide insights into the triumph and failure of these approximations in general context

millisecond pulsars MSPs from observations collected with the Parkes telescope Murr yang The pulsars were found during re processing of archival survey data by Micka liger et al One of the new pulsars PSR has spin period ms and is isolated The other two PSR with ms and PSR with ms are in binary systems around low mass companions Their cid respective orbital periods are and While PSR has low orbital On the Hyper parameters in Stochastic Gradient Descent with Momentum Bin Shi August Abstract Following the same routine as SJ we continue to present the theoretical analysis for stochastic gradient descent with momentum SGD with momentum in this paper Die rent ly for SGD with momentum we demonstrate it is the two hyper parameters together the learning rate and the momentum coe cie nt that play the sign cant role for the linear rate of convergence in non convex optimization Our analysis is based on the use of hyper parameters dependent stochastic dieren ti al equation hp dependent DE that serves as continuous surrogate for SGD with momentum Similarly we establish the linear convergence for the continuous time formulation of SGD with momentum and obtain an explicit expression for the optimal linear rate by analyzing the spectrum of the Kramer Fokker Planck operator By comparison we demonstrate how the optimal linear rate of convergence and the nal gap for SGD only about the learning rate varies with the momentum coe cie nt increasing from zero to one when the momentum is introduced Then we propose mathematical interpretation why the SGD with momentum converges faster and more robust about the learning rate than the standard SGD in practice Finally we show the Nesterov momentum under the existence of noise has no essential die rence with the standard momentum Keywords non convex optimization stochastic gradient descent with momentum hp dependent DE hp dependent kinetic Fokker Planck equation Kramer operator Kramer Fokker Planck operator Nesterov momentum AMS subject classic ation

Distribution ally Robust Resource Planning Under Binomial Demand In takes Russell in lie Ben Black Tri vikram Do kka Christopher Kirk bride August Abstract In this paper we consider distribution ally robust resource planning model inspired by real world service industry problem in which there is mixture of known demand and uncertain future demand Prior to having full knowledge of the demand we must decide upon how many jobs we will complete on each day of the plan Any jobs that are not completed by the end of their due date incur cost and become due the following day We present distribution ally robust optimisation DR model where we treat the number of uncertain jobs due on each day as binomial random variable with unknown parameters We make use of theoretical properties of the binomial distribution to present simple and fast algorithm for the two day model We present theoretical results regarding the near optimal it of this algorithm namely that it nds the worst case distribution for subset of the solution space For the multi day model we extend this algorithm and present two others one based on the cutting surface algorithm commonly seen in the DR literature and one based on probability based reduction of the uncertainty set for the uncertain parameters We test these algorithms on number of die rent problem instances to establish their performance Keywords Uncertainty modelling distribution ally robust optimisation heuristics resource planning

Novel convex decomposition of piecewise ne functions Nils Sch lute and Moritz Schulze Dar up Abstract In this paper we present novel approach to decompose given piecewise ne PW function into two convex PW functions Convex decomposition are useful to speed up or distribute evaluations of PW functions Die rent approaches to construct convex decomposition have already been published However either the two resulting convex functions have very high or very die rent complexities which is often undesirable or the decomposition procedure is inapplicable even for simple cases Our novel method ology sign cant ly reduces these drawbacks in order to extend the applicability of convex decomposition Keywords Piecewise ne functions convex decomposition explicit MPC Preamble This paper is reprint of contribution late breaking result to the st IF AC World Congress Motivation and overview PW functions arise frequently in automatic control and elsewhere popular example is explicit model predictive control Classically the evaluation of PW function for given in its domain is two stage First the segment of that belongs to is den tied Second the corresponding ne function is evaluated More ec ent or distributed evaluations of PW functions can be realized by rewriting as the die rence of two convex PW functions In fact convexity of PW functions can be exploited to reduce memory consumption and computational ort sign cant ly Another application of convex decomposition is DC programming that allows to globally solve certain non convex optimization problems While convex decomposition are useful their construction is typically cumbersome For instance the approach presented in decomposes into two convex PW functions and where especially the construction of is numerically demanding simpler construction is proposed in but the procedure is often not applicable In this paper we present novel convex decomposition that reduces the weaknesses of both existing approaches while maintaining their strengths To this end we summarize the existing approaches in Section Our novel method is presented in Section and illustrated with an example in Section Finally conclusions are given in Section Nils Sch lute and Moritz Schulze Dar up are with the Control and Cyber physical Systems Group Department of Mechanical Engineering TU Dortmund University Germany mails Ec ent Ver cation of Boson Sampling Using Quantum Computer Sri tam Kumar at path Vall bh Vi hu Su dev Pr adhan Bi kash Be her and Pra santa Pa nigra hi Department of Physics Indian Institute of Science Education and Research Ber ham pur Bi kash Quantum OPC Private Limited Balin di Mohan pur Nadia West Bengal India Department of Physical Sciences Indian Institute of Science Education and Research Kolkata Mohan pur West Bengal India Boson sampling is sub universal model used to show quantum speed up However the methods of validation to prove quantum speedup are not robust and accurate All ver cation methods involve additional or little studied assumptions Here we use the protocols given in the paper ar Xiv to construct boson sampling experiment using discrete quantum states on IBM quantum computer and verify the del it of the output states using he ero dyne detection We demonstrate the protocols for single mode del it estimation multi mode del it estimation and ver cation protocol using IBM athens chip Moreover we illustrate the use of this ver cation protocol in the quantum key distribution process for estimating the del it of die rent types of encoding decoding basis This shows that the ver cation protocols can be used to enable ec ent and reliable cert cation of highly entangled multi particle states

CI RED Conference Geneva September Paper EFFICIENT DISTRIBUTION GRID FLEXIBILITY PROVISION THROUGH MODEL BASED MV GRID AND MODEL LESS LV GRID APPROACH An kur Majumdar Omid liza deh Mousavi De psy Pui doux Switzerland an kur majumdar de psy com Keywords FLEXIBILITY SENSITIVITY COEFFICIENTS MODEL LESS DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM OPERATOR DSO DER MANAGEMENT SYSTEM DE RMS Abstract In order to maintain security and quality of supply while supporting increased intermittent generation and electrification of heating and transport at the LV grid the provision of flexibility in the framework of distribution grid operation is pivotal However the availability of updated and accurate LV grid model is challenge for the distribution system operator DSO This paper demonstrates methodology of efficient flexibility provision and activation through sensitivity coefficients based model less LV grid and modelled MV grid approach The paper further illustrates the value of monitoring and control through LV DE RMS platform for efficient realisation of this flexibility provision and activation The methodology has been tested on real MV and LV network of Swiss DSO The results show that there is reduction of cost of operation for DSO

CIG RE International Symposium Ljubljana st th June Reshaping the Electric Power System Infrastructure DISTRIBUTION GRID ROBUST OPERATION UNDER FORECAST UNCERTAINTIES WITH FLEXIBILITY ESTIMATION FROM LOW VOLTAGE GRIDS USING MONITORING AND CONTROL EQUIPMENT An kur Majumdar Omid liza deh Mousavi De psy Pui doux Switzerland an kur majumdar de psy com Abstract Due to increased penetration of renewable resources in the distribution grid the distribution system operator DSO faces increased challenges to maintain security and quality of supply Since large proportion of renewables are intermittent generations maintaining production and consumption balance of the electric system is at stake The DSO needs to procure flex ibi li ties not only from large resources but also small scale resources connected to the LV grid Therefore there is need to estimate the aggregate flexibility at the secondary substation available from the LV grids The flexibility estimation can only be achieved through monitoring of LV grid and the distributed energy resources DER connected at the LV level Moreover the variability of intermittent resources affects the flexibility estimation methodology and the DSO operation must be robust to the changes in generation or demand outputs Furthermore the up to date and accurate model of the LV grid is difficult to access This paper demonstrates methodology of estimating flexibility by sensitivity coefficients and thus eliminating the need to have an up to date LV grid model It further presents robust optimisation based methodology for grid operation to address the impact of forecast uncertainties associated with the variable DER output The methodologies illustrate the value of grid monitoring with monitoring equipment It has been validated on real network of Swiss DSO with several grid monitoring devices Keywords Distribution system operator DSO LV monitoring sensitivity coefficients digitalis ation distributed energy resources DER

Reconciling high resolution climate datasets using Kri gR Richard Davy Erik Kusch Nan sen Environmental and Remote Sensing Center Jah ne bak ken Bergen Norway Center for Biodiversity Dynamics in Changing World BIO CHANGE Section for Eco informatics Biodiversity Department of Biology rhus University richard davy ne rsc no ABSTRACT There is an increasing need for high spatial and temporal resolution climate data for the wide community of researchers interested in climate change and its consequences Currently there is large mismatch between the spatial resolutions of global climate model and reanalysis datasets at best around and respectively and the resolutions needed by many end users of these datasets which are typically on the scale of arcseconds This need for improved spatial resolution in climate datasets has motivated several groups to statistically downscale various combinations of observational or reanalysis datasets However the variety of down scaling methods and inputs used makes it difficult to reconcile the resultant differences between these high resolution datasets Here we make use of the Kri gR package to statistically downscale the world leading ERA Land reanalysis data using rig ing We show that rig ing can accurately recover spatial heterogeneity of climate data given strong relationships with co variate that by preserving the uncertainty associated with the statistical down scaling one can investigate and account for confidence in high resolution climate data and that the statistical uncertainty provided by Kri gR can explain much of the difference between widely used high resolution climate datasets CHEL Terra Climate and World lim depending on variable timescale and region This demonstrates the advantages of using Kri gR to generate customized high spatial and or temporal resolution climate data

RANDOMIZED SOURCE SKETCHING FOR FULL WAVEFORM IN VERSION PRE PRINT KamalA ghaz de Institute of Geophysics University of Tehran Tehran Iran ghaz de kamal ut ac ir Hossein Agha iry University Cote Azur CNRS RD OCA Geo azur Val bonne France agha iry geo azur nice fr Ali Ghola mi Institute of Geophysics University of Tehran Tehran Iran ghola mi ut ac ir Stephane Oper to University Cote Azur CNRS RD OCA Geo azur Val bonne France oper to geo azur nice fr August ABSTRACT Partial differential equation DE constrained optimization problems such as seismic full wave form in version FW frequently arise in the geoscience and related lds For such problems many observations are usually gathered by multiple sources which form the right hand sides of the DE constraint Solving the inverse problem with such massive datasets is computationally demanding in particular when dealing with large number of model parameters This paper proposes novel randomized source sketching method for the efc ent resolution of multi source DE constrained optimization problems We rst formulate the different source encoding strategies used in seismic imaging into unie framework based on randomized sketching To this end the source di men sion of the problem is projected in smaller domain by suitably de ned projection matrix that gathers the physical sources in super sources through weighted summation This reduction in the number of physical sources decreases sign cant ly the number of DE solves while suit able sparsity promoting regular iz ation cane fci ent ly mitigate the footprint of the cross talk noise to maintain the convergence speed of the algorithm We implement the randomized sketching method in an extended search space formulation of frequency domain FW which relies on the alternating direction method of multipliers AD MM Numerical examples carried out with series of well documented benchmarks demonstrate that the randomized sketching algorithm reduces the cost of large scale problems by at least one order of magnitude compared to the original deterministic algorithm

NETWORK OF SCIENTIFIC CONCEPTS EMPIRICAL ANALYSIS AND MODELING VA SYL PAL CH KOV MARIANA KR AS NY TSK OLE YA RY GLOD YURI HOL OVA TCH August Collaboration Doctoral College for the Statistical Physics of Com plex Systems Leipzig Lorraine Lviv Coventry Europe Institute for Condensed Matter Physics National Acad Sci of Ukraine Lviv Ukraine Centre for Fluid and Complex Systems Coventry University Coventry CV FB United Kingdom Abstract Concepts in certain domain of science are linked via intrinsic connections ree ting the structure of knowledge To get qualitative insight and quantitative description of this structure we perform em piri cal analysis and modeling of the network of sci en tic concepts in the domain of physics To this end we use collection of manuscripts submitted to the print repository ar Xiv and the vocabulary of sci en tic concepts collected via the Science WISE info platform and con struct network of sci en tic concepts based on their co occurrences in publications The resulting complex network possesses number of spec ic features high node density is sort at iv it structural corre la ions skewed node degree distribution that can not be understood as result of simple growth by several commonly used network models We show that the model based on simultaneous account of two fac tors growth by blocks and preferential selection gives an explanation of empirically observed properties of the concepts network Pre print of an article accepted for publication in Advances in Complex Systems journal copyright World Sci en tic Publishing Company pal ch kov gmail com

Hierarchical porous materials made by stereo lithographic printing of photo curable emulsions Nicole leger Clara Minas Patrick Boss hard co po Matt ich Kunal Ma sania Andr Stud art Complex Materials Department of Materials ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland Soft Materials Department of Materials ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland Current address Shaping Matter Lab Faculty of Aerospace Engineering Delft University of Technology lu ver weg HS Delft Netherlands corresponding authors ma sania tu delft nl andre stud art mat et hz ch Keywords Pickering Emulsions stereo lithography hierarchical materials porous ceramics bio inspired composites Abstract Porous materials are relevant for broad range of technologies from catalysis and filtration to tissue engineering and lightweight structures Controlling the porosity of these materials over multiple length scales often leads to enticing new functionalities and higher efficiency but has been limited by manufacturing challenges and the poor understanding of the properties of hierarchical structures Here we report an experimental platform for the design and manufacturing of hierarchical porous materials via the stereo lithographic printing of stable photo curable Pickering emulsions In the printing process the micron sized droplets of the emulsified resins work as soft templates for the incorporation of micro scale porosity within sequentially photo polymer zed layers The light patterns used to polymer ize each layer on the building stage further generate controlled pores with bespoke three dimensional geometries at the millimetre scale Using this combined fabrication approach we create architecture lattices with mechanical properties tune able over several orders of magnitude and large complex shaped inorganic objects with unprecedented porous designs

Chiral valley phonons and at ph on on bands in moire materials Indra it Mai ty rash Most and Johannes Lis chner Departments of Materials and Physics and the Thomas Young Centre for Theory and Simulation of Materials Imperial College London South Kensington Campus London SW AZ UK We investigate the chirality of ph on on modes in twisted bilayer Se We demonstrate distinct chiral behavior of the cid valley ph on on modes for twist angles close to and close to Moreover we discover two sets of well separated chiral valley modes in moire lattices for angles close to These emergent moire chiral valley phonons originate from in version symmetry breaking at the moire scale We also nd similar emergent chiral modes in moire patterns of strain engineered bilayer Se and MoS Se he ero structure Furthermore we observe the at ten ing of bands near the ph on onic band gap edges for broad range of twist angles in twisted bilayer Se Our dings which are expected to be generic for moire systems composed of two dimensional materials that breakin version symmetry are relevant for understanding electron ph on on and ex it on ph on on scattering and for designing ph on onic crystals to mimic behaviors of electrons in moire materials

Draft version August Typeset using LATEX two column style in AS TeX THE NATURE OF BLACK HOLE SHADOWS Thomas Bron zw aer and He in Fal cke Department of Astrophysics IMAP Rad bou University Nijmegen Box GL Nijmegen The Netherlands Received August ABSTRACT distinct visual signature occurs in black holes that are surrounded by optically thin and geo met ric ally thick emission regions This signature is sharp edged dip in brightness that is coincident with the black hole shadow which is the projection of the black holes unstable photon region on the observers sky We highlight two key mechanisms responsible for producing the sharp edged dip the reduction of intensity observed in rays that intersect the unstable photon region and thus the perfectly absorbing event horizon versus rays that do not blocking and ii the increase of intensity observed in rays that travel along extended horizon circling paths near the boundary of the unstable photon region path lengthening We demonstrate that the black hole shadow is distinct phenomenon from the photon ring and that models exist in which the former may be observed but not the latter Ad it ion ally we show that the black hole shadow and its associated visual signature die from the more model dependent brightness depressions associated with thin disk models because for geometrically thick and optically thin emission regions the blocking and path lengthening eec ts are quite general Con sequentially the black hole shadow is robust and fairly model independent observable for ac cretin black holes that are in the deep sub Eddington regime such as low luminosity active galactic nuclei LL AGN Keywords black hole physics radiative transfer accretion
