Conn ment induced impurity states in spin chains Joseph ov rosh Hong zheng Zhao Johannes Knoll and Al vise Bastia nello Blackett Laboratory Imperial College London London SW AZ United Kingdom Department of Physics QM Technical University of Munich Garching Germany Munich Center for Quantum Science and Technology CQ ST Schelling str Munchen Germany Department of Physics and Institute for Advanced Study Technical University of Munich Garching Germany Quantum simulators hold the promise of probing central questions of high energy physics in unable con dense matter platforms for instance the physics of conn ment Local defects can be an obstacle in these setups harming their simulation capabilities However defects in the form of impurities can also be useful as probes of many body correlations and may lead to fascinating new phenomena themselves Here we investigate the interplay between impurity and conn ment physics in basic spin chain setup showing the emergence of new exotic excitation as impurity meson bound states with along lifetime For weak conn ment semi classical approximations can describe the capture process in meson impurity scattering event In the strong conning regime intrinsic quantum effects are visible through the quantization of the emergent bound state energies which can be readily probed in quantum simulators

THE EISLER SHE LAH ISOMORPHISM THEOREM AND THE CONTINUUM HYPOTHESIS MOHAMMAD GOL SHANI AND SAHA RON SHE LAH Abstract We show that eisler isomorphism theorem implies CH We also provide some consistency results about eisler and She lah isomorphism the rem in the absence of CH introduction The eisler She lah isomorphism theorem provides characterization of ele men tar equivalence It says that two models of theory are element ari ly equivalent if and only if they have isomorphic ultra powers In eisler has shown as sum ing CH that in countable language two models of size are elementary equivalent if and only if there exist an ultra lter on such that Later She lah removed the CH assumption inK eisler theorem by showing that if Lisa countable language and are countable models then MN if and only if there exists an ultra lter on such that In She lah has constructed model of FC in which and in which there are countable graphs such that for no ultra lter on This shows that CH is an essential assumption for eisler theorem even for countable models In this paper we discuss eisler theorem in the absence of CH and prove some related results First we show that eisler theorem is indeed equivalent to CH by proving the following theorem Theorem Suppose Then eisler isomorphism theorem fails Mathematics Subject Classic ation Primary The rst authors research has been supported by grant from PM No The second authors research has been partially supported by Israel Science Foundation IS grant no This is publication of second author

VeR LP Python Library for Verification of Digital Designs with Reinforcement Learning BEL JOE SHI BU Indian Institute of Technology Madras India SADHANA Indian Institute of Technology Madras India SHILPA Indian Institute of Technology Madras India PRA TYUS KUMAR Indian Institute of Technology Madras India Digital hardware is verified by comparing its behavior against reference model on range of randomly generated input signals The random generation of the inputs hopes to achieve sufficient coverage of the different parts of the design However such coverage is often difficult to achieve amounting to large verification efforts and delays An alternative is to use Reinforcement Learning RL to generate the inputs by learning to prioritize those inputs which can more efficiently explore the design under test In this work we present VeR LP yan open source library to allow RL driven verification with limited additional engineering overhead This contributes to two broad movements within the EDA community of moving to open source tool chains and reducing barriers for development with Python support We also demonstrate the use of VeR LP for few designs and establish its value over randomly generated input signals CCS Concepts Hardware Functional verification Software and its engineering Software libraries and repositories ACM Reference Format bel Joe Shi bu Sadhana Shilpa and Pra tyus Kumar VeR LP Python Library for Verification of Digital Designs with Reinforcement Learning In ACM New York NY USA pages https doi org nnnn nn nnnn nn

Efc ent Majority Voting in Digital Hardware Stefan Baumgartner Mario Huemer Senior Member IEEE and Michael Lung mayr Member IEEE Abstract In recent years machine learning methods became increasingly important for manifold number of applications However they often suffer from high computational requirements impairing their efc ent use in real time systems even when employing dedicated hardware accelerators Ensemble learning methods are especially suitable for hardware acceleration since they can be constructed from individual learners of low complexity and thus offer large parallel iz ation potential For classic ation the outputs of these learners are typically combined by majority voting which often represents the bottleneck of hardware accelerator for ensemble inference In this work we present novel architecture that allows obtaining majority decision in number of clock cycles that is logarithmic in the number of inputs We show that for the example application of handwritten digit recognition random forest processing engine employing this majority decision architecture implemented on an FPGA allows the classic ation of more than seven million images per second Index Terms Random forests majority decision classic ation el programmable gate array FPGA hardware acceleration

Auto encoders on FPGA for real time unsupervised new physics detection at MHz at the Large Hadron Collider Ekaterina Gov or kova Ema Pul jak The arrest ad Thomas James Vladimir Lon car Maurizio Pier in Adrian Alan Pol Nicol hi elm etti Maks milian Gra zyk and Sion Summers European Organization for Nuclear Research CERN CH Geneva Switzerland Jennifer Nga diu ba Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory Batavia IL USA Thong Nguyen California Institute of Technology Pasadena CA USA Javier Duarte University of California San Diego La Jolla CA USA Zhen bin Wu University of Illinois at Chicago Chicago IL USA Dated August In this paper we show how to adapt and deploy anomaly detection algorithms based on deep auto encoders for the unsupervised detection of new physics signatures in the extremely chall eng ing environment of real time event selection system at the Large Hadron Collider LHC We demonstrate that new physics signatures can be enhanced by three orders of magnitude while staying within the strict latency and resource constraints of typical LHC event lte ring system This would allow for collecting high statistics potentially new physics enhanced datasets for novel physics searches Through per layer highly parallel implementations of network layers support for auto encoder spec ic losses on FPGA and latent space based inference we demonstrate that anomaly detection can be performed as fast as ns using less than of FPGA resources

Ec ent algorithms for collecting the statistics of large scale IP address data Jie Chen Hua Mao College of Computer Science Sichuan University Chengdu China Department of Computer and Information Sciences Northumbria University Newcastle NE ST Abstract Compiling the statistics of large scale IP address data is an essential task in network tra measurement The statistical results are used to evaluate the potential impact of user behaviors on network tra This requires algorithms that are capable of storing and retrieving high volume of IP addresses within time and memory constraints In this paper we present two ec ent algorithms for collecting the statistics of large scale IP addresses that balance time ec ien cy and memory consumption The proposed solutions take into account the sparse nature of the statistics of IP addresses while building the hash function and maintain dynamic balance among layered memory blocks There are two layers in the ur st proposed method each of which contains limited number of memory blocks Each memory block contains elements of size bytes for bit system In contrast to built in hash mapping functions the proposed solution completely avoids expensive hash collisions while retaining the linear time complexity of hash based solutions Moreover the mechanism dynamically determines the hash index length according to the range of IP addresses and can balance the time and memory constraints In addition we propose nec ent parallel scheme to speedup the collection of statistics The experimental results on several synthetic datasets show that the proposed method substantially outperforms the baselines with respect to time and memory space ec ien cy Keywords large scale IP addresses memory blocks hash table sorting network tra

ON THE HYDRODYNAMICS OF ACTIVE MATTER MODELS ON LATTICE RIG NO UX Abstract Active matter has been widely studied in recent years because of its rich phe nomen ology whose mathematical understanding is still partial We present some results based on linking microscopic lattice gases to their macroscopic limit and explore how the mathematical state of the art allows to derive from various types of microscopic dynamics their hydro dynamic limit We present some of the crucial aspects of this theory when ap plied to weakly asymmetric active models We comment on the spec ic challenges one should consider when designing an active lattice gas and in particular underline mathematical and phenom eno logical dieren ces between gradient and non gradient models Our purpose is to provide the physics community as well as member of the mathematical community not pe cia liz ed in the mathematical derivation of scaling limits of lattice gases some key elements in de ning microscopic models and deriving their hydro dynamic limit

system for chung Justus von Liebig Weg Gottingen Germany Pre print online version August ABSTRACT Context Total solar ir radiance allows for the use of the Sun as star for studying observations of stellar lightcurves from recent space missions Aims We aim to study how the mid range periodicity observed in solar activity indices in en ces the total solar ir radiance Methods We studied periodic variations of total solar ir radiance based on SATIRE and SOHO VIRGO data during solar cycles on timescales of Rieger type periodicity Then we compared the power spectrum of oscillations in the total solar ir radiance to st those of sunspot and fa cula data to determine their contributions Results Wavelet analyses of TSI data reveal strong peaks at days and days in cycle while cycle showed periods of days and days There are several periods in the sunspot and fa cula data that are not seen in total solar ir radiance as they probably cancel each other out through simultaneous brightening in fa cula and darkening in sunspots Rieger type periodicity is probably caused by magneto Ross by waves in the internal dynamo layer where the solar cyclic magnetic el is generated Therefore the observed periods in the total solar ir radiance and the wave dispersion relation allow us to estimate the dynamo magnetic el strength as kG Conclusions Total solar ir radiance can be used to estimate the magnetic el strength in the dynamo layer This tool can be of importance in estimating the dynamo magnetic el strength of solar like stars using lightcurves obtained by space missions Keywords Keywords should be given

Slow expand ers invade by forming dented fronts in microbial colonies Hyun seok Lee Je Gore and Kiri ll Koro lev Physics of Living Systems Group Department of Physics Massachusetts Institute of Technology Cambridge MA Department of Physics Graduate Program in Bioinformatics Biological Design Center Boston University Boston MA Abstract Abstract Most organisms grow in space whether they are viruses spreading within host tissue or in va sive species colonizing new continent Evolution typically selects for higher expansion rates during spatial growth but it has been suggested that slower expand ers can take over under certain conditions Here we report an experimental observation of such population dynamics We demonstrate that the slower mutants win not only when the two types are intermixed at the front but also when they are spatially segregated into sectors The latter was thought to be impossible because previous studies focused exclusively on the global competitions mediated by expansion velocities but overlooked the local competitions at sector boundaries We developed theory of sector geometry that accounts for both local and global competitions and describes all possible sector shapes In particular the theory predicted that slower but more competitive mutant forms dented shaped sector as it takes over the expansion front Such sectors were indeed observed experimentally and their shapes matched up quantitatively with the theory In simulations we further explored several mechanism that could provide slow expand ers with local competitive advantage and showed that they are all well described by our theory Taken together our results shed light on previously unexplored outcomes of spatial competition andes tabl isha universal framework to understand evolutionary and ecological dynamics in expanding populations Sign can ce Living organisms never cease to evolve so there is sign cant interest in predicting and controlling evolution in all branches of life sciences from medicine to agriculture The most basic question is whether trait should increase or decrease in given environment The answer seems to be trivial for traits such as the growth rate in bio reactor or the expansion rate of tumor Yet it has been suggested that such traits can decrease rather than increase during evolution Here we report koro lev bu edu

factor for assessing the state of the heart after myocardial infarction MI is to measure whether the myocardium segment is viable after reperfusion or re vascular iz ation therapy Delayed enhancement MRI or DE MRI which is performed several minutes after injection of the contrast agent provides high contrast between viable and non viable myocardium and is therefore method of choice to evaluate the extent of MI To automatically assess myocardial status the results of the EMI DEC challenge that focused on this task represented in this paper The challenges main objectives were twofold First to evaluate if deep learning methods can distinguish between normal and pathological cases Second to automatically calculate the extent of myocardial infarction The publicly available database consists of exams divided into cases with normal MRI after injection of contrast agent and cases with myocardial infarction and then with hyper enhanced area on DE MRI whatever their inclusion in the cardiac emergency department Along with MRI clinical characteristics are also provided The obtained results issued from several works show that the automatic classic ation of an exam is reachable task the best method providing an accuracy of and the automatic segmentation of the myocardium is possible However the segmentation of the diseased area needs to be improved mainly due to the small size of these areas and the lack of contrast with the surrounding structures Keywords DE MRI Myocardium Infarction CNN

Spectroscopy of all charm tetra quark states Roh it Ti war Rath aud and Rai Department of Physics National Institute of Technology Surat Gujarat India Abstract The mass spectra of all charm tetra quark states with the cc cc quark cong ration are in vest gated The coulomb plus linear potential is used in conjunction with the relativistic mass correction term To determine the ting parameters for all charm tetra quarks states cc cc we rst calculate the mass spectra of harmonia cc and its decay constants We estimated the masses of the tetra quark states in their ground and radially excited states For mass spectra of tetra quark states we also included spin spin spin orbital and tensor interactions The mass spectra of harmonia produced in this study are reasonably consistent with experimental and theoretical predictions made by others whilst the mass spectra of the tetra quark states are consistent with previous theoretical predictions We propose that the state which has mass range of GeV and was recently detected by LHC has the quantum numbers and belongs to the wave of the all cham tetra quark state Keywords Hadron ic molecule Exotic hadrons Penta quark Potential model Hadron mass spectra PAC No Pn

to succeed in such systems bin Studying the dynamics of disks in close binaries can help to understand how those planets could have formed Aims We study the impact that numerical and physical parameters have on the dynamics of disks in close binaries We use the ep he system as an example and focus on disk quantities such as disk eccentricity and the precession rate as indicators for the dynamical state of the disks Methods We simulate disks in close binaries by performing two dimensional radiative hydro dynamical simulations using amo died version of the Fargo code First we perform parameter study for die rent numerical parameters to con rm that our results are robust In the second part we study the eec ts of die rent masses and dieren tv is cosi ties on the disks dynamics Results Previous studies on radiative disks in close binaries used too low resolutions and too small simulation domains which impacted the disks dynamics Wend that radiative disks in close binaries after an initialization phase become eccentric with mean eccentricities between to and display slow retrograde precession with periods ranging from Tb in which depends quadratically on the disks mean aspect ratio In general the disks show coherent rigid precession which can be broken however by changes in the opacity law reducing the overall eccentricity of the disk Keywords accretion accretion disks protoplanetary disks hydrodynamics methods numerical planets and satellites form tion

Ident cation in Bayesian Estimation of the Skew ness Matrix in Multivariate Skew Elliptical Distribution Saka Oya Graduate School of Economics Keio University Tokyo Japan and Teruo Nak at sum Faculty of Economics Keio University Tokyo Japan Abstract Harvey et al extended the Bayesian estimation method by ahu et al to multivariate skew elliptical distribution with general skew ness matrix and applied it to Bayesian portfolio optimization with higher moments Although their method is epochal in the sense that it can handle the skew ness dependency among asset returns and incorporate higher moments into portfolio optimization it cannot identify all elements in the skew ness matrix due to label switching in the Gibbs sampler To deal with this ident cation issue we propose to modify their sampling algorithm by imposing positive lower triangular constraint on the skew ness matrix of the multivariate skew elliptical distribution and improved interpret ability Furthermore we propose Bayesian sparse estimation of the skew ness matrix with the horseshoe prior to further improve the accuracy In the simulation study we demonstrate that the proposed method with the ident cation constraint can successfully estimate the true structure of the skew ness dependency while the existing methods ers from the ident cation issue Keywords Bayesian Estimation Ident cation Label Switching Skew Elliptical Distribution Skew ness Matrix

Under consideration for publication in Theory and Practice of Logic Programming FOL ASP FO as Input Language for Answer Set Solvers KY LIAN VAN DE SSEL JO DEV RIEN DT JOOST VEN NE KENS KU Leuven Dept of Computer Science De Naye Campus Sint Kate lij ne Waver Belgium Leuven KU Leuven Institute for Leuven Belgium mail first name lastname ku leuven be submitted January revised January accepted January Abstract Over the past decades Answer Set Programming ASP has emerged as an important paradigm for declarative problem solving Technological progress in this area has been stimulated by the use of common standards such as the ASP Core language While ASP has its roots in non monotonic reasoning or ts have also been made to reconcile ASP with classical rst order logic FO This has resulted in the development of FO an expressive extension of FO which allows ASP like problem solving in purely classical setting This language may be more accessible to domain experts already familiar with FO and maybe easier to combine with other formalism that are based on classical logic It is supported by the IDP inference system which has successfully competed in number of ASP competitions Here however technological progress has been hampered by the limited number of systems that are available for FO In this paper we aim to address this gap by means of translation tool that transforms an FO spec cation into ASP Core there by allowing ASP Core solvers to be used as solvers for FO as well We present experimental results to show that the resulting combination of our translation with an the shelf ASP solver is competitive with the IDP system as way of solving problems formulated in FO Under consideration for acceptance in TPL

Perfect Non radiating Modes in Dielectric Nanoparticles Vasily Kl imov Le be dev Physical Institute Russian Academy of Sciences Lenin sky Prospekt Moscow Russia mail kl imov gmail com Abstract general concept of perfect non radiating modes in dielectric nanoparticles of arbitrary shape is put forward It is proved that such modes exist in xi symmetric dielectric nanoparticles and have unlimited radiative factors With smart tuning of the excitation beams perfect modes appear as deep minima in the scattered radiation spectra up to complete disappearance but at the same time they have giant amplification of the fields inside the particle Such modes have no analogues and can be useful for the realization of low threshold nano lasers and other strong nonlinear effects in nanoparticles At present the properties of dielectric nanoparticles with high refractive index are being actively investigated The physics of optical phenomena in such nanoparticles is very complicated and rich and leads to many interesting applications such as nano antennas nano lasers and nonlinear nano photo nics As in any other field of physics all these phenomena are associated with the existence of certain ei gen modes in nanoparticles For applications modes with strong field localization and low radiation losses are of particular interest This kind of modes attracted the closest attention of the leading scientific groups which discovered several types of weakly radiating modes IC modes an pole states super cavity modes pseudo modes embedded photon ic eigenvalues In this letter we show that in dielectric nanoparticles there are unparalleled perfect non radiating modes and we propose regular method for finding such modes in arbitrary dielectric particles without losses Usually the modes are found by solving source less Maxwell's equations with the Sommerfeld radiation conditions at infinity and therefore such modes are fundamentally related to radiation losses Moreover such modes grow unlimited ly at infinity which leads to

Electrical Tuning of Plasm onic Conducting Polymer Nano antennas Ak ch heta Kar ki Giancarlo Cinco tt Shang zhi Chen Chuan fei Wang Valle ry Stanis he Vanya arak chi eva Mats Fahlman Magnus Jons son Laboratory of Organic Electronics Department of Science and Technology IT Link ping University SE Sweden Terahertz Materials Analysis Center THe MAC Department of Physics Chemistry and Biology IF Link ping University Link ping SE Sweden Center for III Nitride Technology iT Jan zn Department of Physics Chemistry and Biology IF Link ping University Link ping SE Sweden Correspondence magnus jons son liu se Nano structures of conventional metals offer manipulation of light at the nano scale but are limited to static behavior due to their fixed material properties To develop the next frontier of dynamic nano optics and meta surfaces we utilize the redox unable optical properties of conducting polymers which were recently shown to be capable of sustaining plasm on in their most conducting oxidized state Using nano disks of poly ethylene di oxy thi oph ene sulfate PE DOT ulf as model system we present the first electrically unable conducting polymer nano optical antennas In addition to repeated on off switching of the polymeric nano antennas we demonstrate the possibility for gradual electrical tuning of their nano optical response which was found to be related to the modulation of both density and mobility of the mobile polar onic charge carriers in the polymer The presented concept takes important steps towards electrically unable meta surfaces with truly dynamic optical nano antenna pixels with not only varying far field but also unable near field The work paves the way for applications ranging from unable flat meta optics to adaptable smart windows

Power Law Gravity Corrected Canonical Scalar Field nation Oi kono mou Department of Physics Aristotle University of Thessaloniki Thessaloniki Greece Laboratory for Theoretical Cosmology Tomsk State University of Control Systems and Radio electronics Tomsk Russia TU SUR The eec ti ve nation ary Lagrangian is prominent challenge for theoretical cosmologists since it may contain imprints of the quantum epoch In view of the fact that higher order curvature terms might be present in the eec ti ve nation ary Lagrangian in this work we introduce the theoretical framework of power law gravity corrected canonical scalar el nation aiming to study the nation ary dynamics of this new framework The main characteristic of this new theoretical framework is the dominance of power law gravity term Rn with compared to the Einstein Hilbert term In eec the el equations are controlled by the Rn term in contrast to the Einstein Hilbert canonical scalar theory We extract the slow roll el equations and we calculate the slow roll indices of the resulting theory which acquire quite elegant nal form when the slow roll conditions hold true Accordingly we examine quantitatively the nation ary phenom eno logical implications of the theoretical framework we introduced by choosing simple hybrid like scalar el potentials As we evince the resulting theory is in good agreement with the latest Planck data for wide range of the free parameters of the model Thus our theoretical framework makes possible to obtain viable nation ary theories which otherwise would be non viable such as the simple power law gravity model or the simple power law scalar model PAC numbers Cq

The Role of Global Labels in Few Shot Classic ation and How to Infer Them Ru oh an Wang Massimiliano Ponti University College London Is it it to Italian odi Tecnol ogi ru oh an wang cs ucl ac uk University College London massimiliano ponti it it Car loCi liber to University College London ci liber to ucl ac uk Abstract Few shot learning SL is central problem in meta learning where learners must quickly adapt to new tasks given limited training data Surprisingly recent works have outperformed meta learning methods tailored oF SL by casting it as standard supervised learning to jointly classify all classes shared across tasks However this approach violates the standard SL setting by requiring global labels shared across tasks which are often unavailable in practice In this paper we show why solving SL via standard classic ation is theoretically advantageous This motivates us to propose Meta Label Learning MeL novel algorithm that infers global labels and obtains robust few shot models via standard classic ation Empirically we demonstrate that MeL outperforms meta learning competitors and is comparable to the oracle setting where ground truth labels are given We provide extensive abl ation studies to highlight the key properties of the proposed strategy

EP AS for Load Balancing Problem on Parallel Machines with Non renewable Resource Jay krishna and Asaf Levin Faculty of Industrial Engineering and Management The Tech ni on Haifa Israel jay krishna ng hotmail com Faculty of Industrial Engineering and Management The Tech ni on Haifa Israel levin as ie tech ni on ac il Abstract The problem considered is the non preemptive scheduling of independent jobs that consume resource which is non renewable and replenished regularly on parallel uniformly related machines The input de nes the speed of machines size of jobs the quantity of resource required by the jobs the replenished quantities and replenishment dates of the resource Every job can start processing only after the required quantity of the resource is allocated to the job The objective function is the minimization of the convex combination of the make span and an objective that is equivalent to the norm of the vector of loads of the machines We present an EP AS for this problem Prior to our work only PT AS was known in this non renewable resource settings and this PT AS was only for the special case of our problem of make span minimization on identical machines

Astronomy Astrophysics manuscript no corr ESO August ratio and NO abundances in the classical very old metal poor dwarf HD cid Spite Spite and Bar buy GE PI Observatoire de Paris PS Research University CNRS Place Jules Janssen Meudon France Universidade de So Paulo AG Rua do Mato Cidade Universit ria So Paulo Brazil August ABSTRACT Context The isotope abundances provide powerful diagnostics of the chemical enrichment in our Galaxy The star HD is one of the best studied very metal poor dwarf stars It is very old and the chemical abundance in this star is good witness of the chemical composition of the matter in the early Galaxy Aims The aim of this work is to measure the precise abundances of carbon nitrogen oxygen and mainly the isotopic ratio in this very old metal poor star in order to have good reference for the computations of the chemical evolution of the Galaxy Methods We used very high spectral resolution data with extremely high signal to noise ratios obtained with the spectrographs ESPa DOnS at the CF HT ESPRESSO at the VLT and HARPS at the ESO telescope Results For the rst time we were able to measure the ratio in very old metal poor dwarf that was born at the very beginning of the Galaxy We also obtained precise determination of the abundance of the NO elements in this star These abundances give information about the early composition of the cloud from which HD was formed They suggest that the eec of super asymptotic giant branch stars or fast rotating massive stars was sign cantin the early Galaxy Keywords Stars Abundances Galaxy abundances Galaxy halo

Bayesian Analysis of Sparse Multivariate Matched Proportions Mark Meyer Department of Mathematics and Statistics Georgetown University and Tong Li Department of Mathematics and Statistics Georgetown University and Katherine Hobbs Knut son Kraft Center for Community Health Partners in Health August Abstract Multivariate matched proportions MP data appears in variety of contexts including post market surveillance of adverse events in pharmaceuticals disease cl as si cation and agreement between care providers and consists of multiple sets of paired binary measurements taken on the same subject While recent work pro poses non Bayesian methods to address the complexities of MP data the issue of sparsity where no or very few responses are recorded for one or more sets is una dressed However the presence of sparse sets results in underestimates of variance loss of coverage and bias in existing methods Additionally Bayesian methods have not previously been considered for MP data In this work we propose Bayesian marginal probability model for MP data with robust priors that adjusts for spar it using targeted informative priors on the variance components of sparse sets and half Cauchy priors on non sparse sets In simulation we demonstrate our methods ability to handle sparsity and show that it outperforms existing methods in terms of coverage and bias while maintaining comparable power Finally we analyze data from study of care coordination within System of Care framework and provide additional insights that the original uni variate analysis missed

Ecosystem for Closed Time like Curves An Energy Conditions Perspective Sash deep Gut ti haile sh Kul karn Va is hak Prasad and Sheldon Sure sh Bir la Institute of Technology and Science Pila ni Hyderabad Campus Hyderabad India Department of Physics Savitri bai Ph ule Pune University Ganesh hind Pune India Inter University Centre for Astronomy and Astrophysics Post Bag Ganesh hind Pune India Saint Xavier Fort Mumbai Maharashtra India In this article we explore the relationship between the existence of closed time like curves and energy conditions that occur in the Kerr Newman spacetime To quantify the dependence we de nea correlation index between energy conditions and closed time like curves Based on the inputs from Hawking chronology protection conjecture we analyze two popular variants of Kerr Newman spacetime Non commutative and Ras tall Kerr Newman space times These two models provide complementary scenarios that aid in analyzing Hawking statements regarding the correlation of closed time like curves and energy conditions from local and global perspective We report the results outlining the possible role played by violations of energy conditions in eliminating the closed time like curves in two contrasting situations namely in space times with and without curvature singularities

Strong pairing in mixed dimensional bilayer anti ferromagnetic Mott insulators Anna belle Bohr dt Lukas Ho meier Immanuel Bloch Eugene Dem ler and Fabian Grus dt Department of Physics and Institute for Advanced Study Technical University of Munich Garching Germany Munich Center for Quantum Science and Technology CQ ST Schelling str Munchen Germany IT AMP Harvard Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics Cambridge MA USA Department of Physics Harvard University Cambridge MA USA Department of Physics and Arnold Sommerfeld Center for Theoretical Physics AS Ludwig Maximilians Universitat Munchen There sien str Munchen Germany Max Planck Institut fur Quan ten op tik Garching Germany Institute for Theoretical Physics ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland Dated August Interacting many body systems combining conned and extended dimensions such as ladders and few layer systems are characterized by enhanced quantum uc tu at ions which often result in interesting collective properties Recently two dimensional bilayer systems such as twisted bilayer graph ene or ultra cold atoms have sparked lot of interest because they can host rich phase diagrams including unconventional superconductivity Here we present theoretical proposal for realizing high temperature pairing of fermions in class of bilayer Hubbard models We introduce general highly ec ent pairing mechanism for mobile dopant in anti ferromagnetic Mott insulators which leads to binding energies proportional to where is the hopping amplitude of the charge carriers The pairing is caused by the energy that one charge gains when retracing string of frustrated bonds created by another charge Concretely we show that this mechanism leads to the formation of highly mobile but tightly bound pairs in the case of mixed dimensional Fermi Hubbard bilayer systems This setting is closely related to the Fermi Hubbard model believed to capture the physics of copper oxides and can be realized by currently available ultra cold atom experiments

Distributed quantum phase sensing for arbitrary positive and negative weights Chang hun Oh Liang Jiang and Chang hyo up Lee Pritzker School of Molecular Engineering The University of Chicago Chicago Illinois USA Quantum Universe Center Korea Institute for Advanced Study Seoul Republic of Korea Dated August Estimation of global parameter de ned as weighted linear combination of unknown multiple parameters can be enhanced by using quantum resources Advantageous quantum strategies may vary depending on the weight distribution but have rarely been studied Here we propose distributed quantum phase sensing scheme using Gaussian states in order to take into account an arbitrary distribution of the weights with positive and negative signs The optimal estimation precision of the proposed scheme is derived and shown to be achievable by using squeezed states injected into linear beam splitter networks and performing homo dyne detection on them It is shown that entanglement of Gaussian states is advantageous only among the modes assigned with equal signs of the weights whereas is not useful between the modes with opposite weight signs We also provide deeper understanding of our ding by focusing on the two mode case in comparison with the cases using non Gaussian probe states We expect this work to motivate further studies on quantum enhanced distributed sensing schemes considering various types of physical parameters with an arbitrary weight distribution

Improved Feature Importance Computations for Tree Models Shapley vs Ban zha Adam Kar cz marz nish Muk her ee Piotr Sank ow ski Piotr Wy go ck Abstract Shapley values are one of the main tools used to explain predictions of tree ensemble models The main alternative to Shapley values are Ban zha values that have not been understood equally well In this paper we make step towards ling this gap providing both experimental and theoretical comparison of these model explanation methods Surprisingly we show that Ban zha values offer several advantages over Shapley values while providing essentially the same explanations We verify that Ban zha values have more intuitive interpretation allow for more efc ent algorithms are much more numerically robust We provide an experimental evaluation of these these In particular we show that on real world in stances Additionally from theoretical perspective we provide new and improved algorithm computing the same Shapley value based explanations as the algorithm of Lund berge tal Nat Mach In tell Our algorithm run sinO TLD time whereas the previous algorithm had TLD running time bound Here is the number of trees is the maximum number of leaves in tree and denotes the maximum depth of tree in the ensemble Using the computational techniques developed for Shapley values we deliver an optimal TL time algorithm for computing Ban zha values based explanations In our experiments these algorithms give running times smaller even by an order of magnitude All authors were supported by the ER Consolidator Grant TUgbOAT University of Warsaw kar cz marz mim uw edu pl University of Warsaw nish mim uw edu pl IDEAS CBR University of Warsaw and MIM Solutions Warsaw sank mim uw edu pl University of Warsaw and MIM Solutions Warsaw wy gos mim uw edu pl Additionally supported by the Polish National Science Center Grant PRE LU DIM ST

Prepared for submission to CAP forecast of using fast radio burst observations to constrain holographic dark energy Xing Wei Qi Ze Wei Zhao Ling Feng Wang Jing Fei Zhang in Zhang Department of Physics College of Sciences Northeastern University Shenyang China Key Laboratory of Data Analytics and Optimization for Smart Industry Ministry of Ed cation Northeastern University Shenyang China mail qi xing wei stu mail neu edu cn zhao zw stu mail neu edu cn ling feng wang stu mail neu edu cn zhang mail neu edu cn zhang in mail neu edu cn Abstract Recently about ve hundred fast radio bursts FR Bs detected by CHIME FR Project have been reported The vast amounts of data would make FR Bs promising low redshift cosmological probe in the forthcoming years and thus the issue of how many FR Bs are needed for precise cosmological parameter estimation in die rent dark energy models should be detailed ly investigated Die rent from the usually considered parameterized models in the literature in this work we investigate the holographic dark energy DE model and the Ricci dark energy RDE model which originate from the holographic principle of quantum gravity using the simulated localized FR data as cosmological probe for the rst time We show that the Hubble constant can be constrained to about precision in the DE model with the Mac quart relation of FR by using accurately localized FR Bs combined with the current CMB data which is similar to the precision of the SH ES value Using localized FR Bs combined with the CMB data can achieve about constraint on the dark energy parameter in the DE model which is tighter than the current BAO data combined with CMB We also study the combination of the FR data and another low redshift cosmological probe gravitational wave GW standard siren data with the purpose of measuring cosmological parameters independent of CMB Although the parameter de genera cie inherent in FR and in GW are rather die rent we nd that more than FR Bs are demanded to eec iv ely improve the constraints in the holographic dark energy models Corresponding author

Brownian Curzon Ahl born heat engine Chen in Fu Chen Zhao yu Fei and Quan School of Physics Peking University Beijing China Beijing Computational Science Research Center Beijing China Graduate School of China Academy of Engineering Physics No Xi bei wang East Road Hai dian District Beijing China Collaborative Innovation Center of Quantum Matter Beijing China Frontiers Science Center for Nano op to electronics Peking University Beijing China Dated August The Curzon Ahl born CA ec ien cy as the ec ien cy at the maximum power EMP of the endo reversible Carnot engine has sign cant impact in nite time thermodynamics In the past two decades lot of or ts have been made to seek microscopic theory of the CA ec ien cy It is generally believed that the CA ec ien cy is approached in the symmetric low dissipation regime of dynamical models Contrary to the general belief without the low dissipation assumption we formulate microscopic theory of the CA engine realized with an under damped Brownian particle in class of non harmonic potentials This microscopic theory not only explains the dynamical origin of all assumptions made by Curzon and Ahl born but also con rms that in the highly under damped regime the CA ec ien cy is always the EMP irrespective of the symmetry of the dissipation The low dissipation regime is included in the microscopic theory as special case Also based on this theory we obtain the control scheme associated with the maximum power for any given ec ien cy as well as analytical expressions of the power and the ec ien cy statistics for the Brownian CA engine Our research brings new perspectives to experimental study of nite time microscopic heat engines featured with uc tu at ions

thomas vu ill ume lapp in fr The Cherenkov Telescope Array CTA is the future ground based gamma ray observatory and will be composed of two arrays of imaging atmospheric Cherenkov telescopes ACTs located in the Northern and Southern hemispheres respectively The rst CTA prototype telescope built on site the Large Sized Telescope ST is under commissioning in La Palma and has already taken data on numerous known sources ACTs detect the faint ash of Cherenkov light indirectly produced after very energetic gamma ray photon has interacted with the atmosphere and generated an atmospheric shower Reconstruction of the characteristics of the primary photons is usually done using parameter iz ation up to the third order of the light distribution of the images In order to go beyond this classical method new approaches are being developed using state of the art methods based on convolutional neural networks CNN to reconstruct the properties of each event incoming direction energy and particle type directly from the telescope images While promising these methods are notoriously di cult to apply to real data due to dieren ces such as die rent levels of night sky background between Monte Carlo MC data used to train the network and real data The Gamma Learn project based on these CNN approaches has already shown an increase in sensitivity on MC simulations for ST as well as lower energy threshold This work applies the Gamma Learn network to real data acquired by ST and compares the results to the classical approach that uses random forests trained on extracted image parameters The improvements on the background rejection event direction and energy reconstruction are discussed in this contribution th International Cosmic Ray Conference ICRC July th rd Online Berlin Germany Technical Report on Virtual TAP Web Aut hn Authentic at or Chris ulna ne Christopher Newton and Helen Tre arne Castel late Consulting Ltd chris castel late com Department of Computer Science University of Surrey newton tre arne surrey ac uk December Abstract Even though password less authentication to online accounts ers greater security and protection from attack passwords remain prevalent Password less authentication adoption is impacted by the slow adoption of external hardware keys required to generate the security keys within the authentication protocol We have developed virtual Web Aut hn au then tic at or in order to provide an extensible open source platform for understanding the associated standards of Web Aut hn and TAP Our authentic at or provides secure software authentication for devices that do not have access to physical hardware interface Our authentic at or also provides an alternative to an external physical hardware key and supports the use of trusted platform module PM on device to generate the security keys within Web Aut hn protocol

ON THE SPECTRUM OF AN OPERATOR ASSOCIATED WITH LEAST SQUARES FINITE ELEMENTS FOR LINEAR ELASTICITY LINDA LZ BEN AND DANIELE OF FI Abstract In this paper we provide some more details on the numerical an aly is and we present some enlightening numerical results related to the spectrum of nite element least squares approximation of the linear elasticity for mu la tion introduced recently We show that although the formulation is robust in the incompressible limit for the source problem its spectrum is strongly dependent on the Lame parameters and on the underlying mesh Keywords Eigenvalue problem linear elasticity least squares nite elements AMS subject classic ation

Department of Computer and Software Engineering ETS Montreal Canada Department of Computer Science Sherbrooke University Canada Abstract The physical and clinical constraints surrounding diu sion weighted imaging WI often limit the spatial resolution of the pro duce images to vox els up to times larger than those of images Thus the detailed information contained in images could help in the synthesis of diu sion images in higher resolution However the non Euclidean nature of diu sion imaging hinders current deep generative models from synthesizing physically plausible images In this work we propose the rst Riemann ian net work architecture for the direct generation of diu sion tensors DT and diu sion orientation distribution functions dO DF from high resolution images Our integration of the Log Euclidean Metric into learning objective guarantees unlike standard Euclidean networks the mathematically valid synthesis of diu sion Furthermore our approach improves the fractional an iso tro py mean squared error FAM SE between the synthesized diu sion and the ground truth by more than and the cosine similarity between principal directions by almost when compared to our baselines We validate our generated diu sion by comparing the resulting tract ogram to our expected real data We observe similar ber bundles with streamlines having less than die rence in length less than die rence in volume and visually close shape While our method is able to generate high resolution diu sion images from structural inputs in less than seconds we acknowledge and discuss the limits of diu sion inference solely relying on images Our results nonetheless suggest relationship between the high level geometry of the brain and the overall white matter architecture Keywords Diu sion synthesis Manifold valued data Riemann ian geometry

Apportionment with Parity Constraints Claire Mathieu Victor Verdugo Abstract In the classic apportionment problem the goal is to decide how many seats of parliament should be allocated to each party as result of an election The divisor methods provide way of solving this problem by de ning notion of proportionality guided by some rounding rule Motivated by recent challenges in the context of electoral apportionment we consider the question of how to allocate the seats of parliament under parity constraints between candidate types equal number of men and women elected while at the same time satisfying party proportionality We consider two different approaches for this problem The rst mechanism that follows greedy approach corresponds to recent mechanism used in the Chilean Constitutional at Convention election We analyze this mechanism from theoretical point of view The second mechanism follows the idea of bi proportionality introduced by Balin ski and De mange Math Program Math Oper Res In contrast with the classic bi proportional method by Balin ski and De mange this mechanism is ruled by two levels of proportional it Proportionality is satis ed at the level of parties by means of divisor method and then bi proportionality is used to decide the number of candidates allocated to each type and party We provide theoretical analysis of this mechanism making progress on the the ret ical understanding of methods with two levels of proportionality typical benchmark used in the context of two dimensional apportionment is the fair share matrix scaling which corresponds to an ideal fractional bi proportional solution We provide lower bounds on the distance between these two types of solutions and we explore their consequences in the context of two dimensional apportionment CNRS IR IF Universit de Paris France claire mathieu ir if fr Institute of Engineering Sciences Universidad deO Higgins Chile victor verdugo oh cl

The role of point discharge during Thunderstorm Ground Enhancements GEs Mari beth to lz enburg and Thomas Marshall Department of Physics and Astronomy University of Mississippi University MS USA Corresponding author Mari beth to lz enburg stol zen ph ole miss edu Abstract new explanation for the increased fluxes of high energy particles detected in Thunderstorm Ground Enhancements GEs is suggested Point discharge which occurs ordinarily at the surface beneath electrified clouds when the field reaches threshold magnitude is proposed to generate the conditions of very large electric fields for rays and gamma rays to be emitted via br ems st rah lung near the tips of grounded conducting points These rays and gamma rays are then detected with instrumentation located very nearby The well documented occurrences of GEs accompanied by unusually large magnitudes of electric field at the ground beneath the storm nominally support this hypothesis although additional calibrated electric field data should be acquired It is recommended that point discharge processes be studied further to establish or eliminate their relevance to the problem of GE occurrence and variability to lz enburg Marshall Point discharge hypothesis for GEs submitted to Geo ph ys Res Let Aug

COUPLED MODEL FOR THE LINKED DYNAMICS OF MARINE POLLUTION BY MICRO PLASTICS AND PLASTIC RELATED ORGANIC POLLUTANTS PRE PRINT Fed eric aGue rini Lorenzo Mari Di parti men to diE let tronic In form azione Bio inge gner Di parti men to diE let tronic In form azione Bio inge gner Polite nico di Milano Polite nico di Milano Via Ponzi Milan Italy Via Ponzi Milan Italy fed erica gu err in poli mi it lorenzo mari poli mi it Renato Casa grand Di parti men to diE let tronic In form azione Bio inge gner Polite nico di Milano Via Ponzi Milan Italy renato casa grand poli mi it ABSTRACT The pervasive ness of micro plastics in global oceans is raising concern about its impacts on organisms While quantifying its toxicity is still an open issue sampling evidence has shown that rarely is marine micro plastics found clean rather it is often contaminated by other types of chemical pollutants some known to be harmful to biota and humans To provide rst tool for assessing the role of micro plastics as vectors of plastic related organic pollutants PROPs we developed data informed model that accounts for the intertwined dynamics of Lagrangian micro plastic particles transported by surface currents and the Eulerian advection diffusion of chemicals that partition on them through seawater particle interaction Focusing on the Mediterranean Sea and using simple yet realistic forcings for the input of PROPs our simulations highlight that micro plastics can mediate PROP export across different sub seas Particle origin in terms of both source type either coastal riverine or shing derived and geographical location seems to play major role in determining the amount of PROPs conveyed by micro plastics during their journey at sea We argue that quantitative numerical modelling approaches can be focal to shed some light on the vast spatial and temporal scales of micro plastics PROPs interaction complementary to much needed on el investigation Keywords micro plastics marine pollution Lagrangian modelling Eulerian modeling advection diffusion hydrophobic pollutants

studying planets in and beyond the solar system Previous si mula ions using global general circulation models GCMs found that for tidally locked synchronously rotating terrestrial planets with oceans strong convergence and convection produce optically thick clouds over the sub stellar area One obvious weak ness of these studies is that clouds are parameterized based on the knowledge on Earth and whether it is applicable to exo planetary environment is unknown Here we use cloud resolving model CR with high resolution km in two dimensional cong ration to simulate the clouds and circulation on tidally locked aqua planets We con rm that the sub stellar area is covered by deep convective clouds the night side is dominated by low level stratus clouds and these two are linked by global scale overturning circulation We further nd that uniform warming of the surface causes the width of convection and clouds to decrease but decrease of day night surface temperature contrast or an increase of longwave radiative cooling rate causes the width of convection and clouds to increase These relationships can be roughly interpreted based on some simple thermodynamic theories Comparing the results between CR and CM we nd that the results are broadly similar although there are many sig ni cant dieren ces Future work is required to use CR with realistic radiative transfer and with the Coriolis force to examine the clouds and climate of tidally locked planets

Long Horizon Manipulation of Unknown Objects via Task and Motion Planning with Estimated Afford ances Aidan Curtis Xiao lin Fang Leslie Pack Ka elbling Tomas Loz no Perez Ca elan Reed Garrett Abstract We present strategy for designing and building very general robot manipulation systems involving the in te gra tion of general purpose task and motion planner with engi nee red and learned perception modules that estimate properties and afford ances of unknown objects Such systems are closed loop policies that map from RGB images depth images and robot joint encoder measurements to robot joint position com and We show that following this strategy task and motion planner can be used to plan intelligent behaviors even in the absence of priori knowledge regarding the set of mani pul able objects their geometries and their afford ances We explore several different ways of implementing such perceptual modules for segmentation property detection shape estimation and grasp generation We show how these modules are integrated within the DDL Stream task and motion planning framework Finally we demonstrate that this strategy can enable single system to perform wide variety of real world multi step manipulation tasks generalizing over broad class of objects object arrangements and goals without any prior knowledge Fig The goal is for all perceivable objects to be on blue target region of the environment and without re training The robot rst nds and executes plan that picks and places the cracker box on the blue target region After re perceiving the scene and identifying

The Maxwell spectrum bifurcation on the Schwarz child black holes in cavity with vanishing energy ux boundary conditions Yun he Lei Meng jie Wang and Ji liang Jing Department of Physics and Syne get ic Innovation Center for Quantum Eec ts and Applications Hunan Normal University Changsha Hunan China Dated August We perform systematic study of the Maxwell quasi normal spectrum in mirror like cavity following the generic vanishing energy ux principle by starting with the Schwarz child black holes in this paper The vanishing energy ux principle leads to two die rent sets of boundary conditions and therefore two die rent sets of modes In pure cavity the Maxwell equations resolved analytically and we obtain two distinct sets of normal modes which is contradictory to the counterpart of the anti de Sitter AdS case For the case of black holes in cavity we solve the Maxwell equations numerically and the Maxwell spectrum is explored by varying the mirror radius the angular momentum quantum number cid and the overtone number In particular we proclaim that the Maxwell spectrum may bifurcate for both boundary conditions when the mirror is placed around the black hole event horizon which is analogous to the spectrum bifurcation eec ts found for the Maxwell lds on asymptotically AdS black holes This observation provides another example to exhibit the similarity between black holes in cavity and the AdS black holes

Universal thermodynamics of an SU Fermi Hubbard Model Eduardo barra Garc Padilla So hail Das gupta Hao Tian Wei Shintaro Tai Yoshiro Takahashi Richard Scale tar and aden Hazzard Rice Center for Quantum Materials Department of Physics Rice University Houston TX USA Department of Physics Graduate School of Science Kyoto University Japan Department of Physics University of California Davis CA USA Dated August The SU symmetric Fermi Hubbard model FHM plays an essential role in strongly correlated fermionic many body systems In the one particle per site and strongly interacting limit cid it is eec iv ely described by the Heisenberg Hamiltonian In this limit enlarging the spin and ex tending the typical SU symmetry toSU has been predicted to give exotic phases of matter in the ground state with complicated dependence on This raises the question of what if any are the nite temperature signatures of these phases especially in the currently experimentally relevant regime near or above the super exchange energy We explore this question for thermo dynamic observable by numerically calculating the thermodynamics of the SU FHM in the two dimensional square lattice near densities of one particle per site using determinant Quantum Monte Carlo and Numerical Linked Cluster Expansion Interestingly wend that for temperatures above the super exchange energy where the correlation length is short the energy number of on site pairs and kinetic energy are universal functions of Although the physics in the regime studied is well beyond what can be captured by low order high temperature series we show that an analytic description of the scaling is possible in terms of only one and two site calculations

Measuring the dark matter environments of black hole binaries with gravitational waves Adam Coogan Gianfranco Bertone Daniele Gag gero Bradley Kavanagh and David Nichols Gravitation Astro particle Physics Amsterdam GRAPPA Institute for Theoretical Physics Amsterdam and Delta Institute for Theoretical Physics University of Amsterdam Science Park XH Amsterdam The Netherlands Instituto de sica Teo rica AM SIC Campus de Can to blanco Madrid Spain Instituto de sica de Cantabria IF CA UC SIC Av de Los Castro Santander Spain Department of Physics University of Virginia Box Charlottesville Virginia USA Large dark matter over densities can form around black holes of astrophysical and primordial origin as they form and grow This dark dress inevitably ect the dynamical evolution of binary systems and induces de phasing in the gravitational waveform that can be probed with future interferometers In this paper we introduce new analytical model to rapidly compute gravitational waveforms in presence of an evolving dark matter distribution We then present Bayesian analysis determining when dressed black hole binaries can be distinguished from GR in vacuum ones and how well their parameters can be measured along with how close they must be to be detectable by the planned Laser Interferometer Space Antenna LISA We show that LISA can den it iv ely distinguish dark dresses from standard binaries and characterize the dark matter environments around astrophysical and primordial black holes for wide range of model parameters Our approach can be generalized to assess the prospects for detecting classifying and characterizing other environmental eec ts in gravitational wave physics Keywords dark matter intermediate mass black holes gravitational waves LISA

On the relationship between variable Wiener index and variable Sze ged index Sti jn Cam bie John Has le grave th August Abstract We resolve two conjectures of Hr in kova Kn or and Sk re kov ski concerning the relationship between the variable Wiener index and variable Sze ged index for connected non complete graph one of which would imply the other The strong conjecture is that for any such graph there is critical exponent in below which the variable Wiener index is larger and above which the variable Sze ged index is larger The weak conjecture is that the variable Sze ged index is always larger for any exponent exceeding They proved the weak conjecture for bipartite graphs and the strong conjecture for trees In this note we disprove the strong conjecture although we show that it is true for almost all graphs and for bipartite and block graphs We also show that the weak conjecture holds for all graphs by proving major iz ation relationship Keywords variable Wiener index variable Sze ged index topological indices MSC

Spin orbit eec ts in pentavalent Iri dates Models and materials Say anti ka how al School of Physical Sciences Indian Association for the Cultivation of Science adav pur Kolkata India current address Materials Theory ETH Zurich Wolfgang Pauli Stra sse Zurich Switzerland mail say anti ka how al mat et hz ch Indra Das gupta School of Physical Sciences Indian Association for the Cultivation of Science adav pur Kolkata India mail pid iac res in Abstract Spin orbit eec ts in heavy transition metal oxides in particular iri dates have received enormous current interest due to the prediction as well as the realization of plethora of exotic and unconventional magnetic properties While bulk of these works are based on tetra valent iri dates where the counter intuitive insulating state of the rather extended orbitals are explained by invoking strong spin orbit coupling the recent quest in iri date research has shifted to the other valen cie of Ir of which pentavalent iri dates constitute notable representative In contrast to the tetra valent iri dates spin orbit entangled electrons in systems are expected to be conned to the single state without any resultant moment or magnetic response However it has been recently predicted that magnetism in systems may occur via magnetic condensation of excitation across spin orbit coupled states In reality the magnetism in Ir systems are often quite debatable both from theoretical as well as experimental point of view Here we provide comprehensive overview of the spin orbit coupled model systems and its implications in the studied pentavalent iri dates In particular we review here the current experimental and theoretical understanding of the double per ovsk it BY rO Sr Ba Sc Gd per ovsk it Ba MIr Zn Mg Sr Ca post per ovsk it NaIr and Hexagonal Sr MIrO iri dates along with number of open questions that require future investigation

Boundary control ability for degenerate and singular wave equation Brahim All al Fa cult des Sciences et Techniques Universit Hassan er Labor to ire MISI Sett at Morocco email all al hp ac ma Al habib Mou ni Moula Ismail University of Mek nes ST Err achi dia MA IS Laboratory MA MCS Group Box Bout al amine Err achi dia Morocco email al habib mou ni gmail com Jaw ad Sal hi Moula Ismail University of Mek nes ST Err achi dia MA IS Laboratory MA MCS Group Box Bout al amine Err achi dia Morocco email sj sal hi gmail com Abstract In this paper we deal with the boundary control ability of one dimensional de generate and singular wave equation with degeneracy and singularity occurring at the boundary of the spatial domain Exact boundary control ability is proved in the range of sub critical critical potentials and for uci ent ly large time through boundary con roller acting away from the degenerate singular point By duality argument we reduce the problem to an ob ser ability estimate for the corresponding ad joint system which is proved by means of the multiplier method and new special Hardy type inequality

Color conn ment at the boundary of the con formally compact ed AdS Kir ch bacha Pop ov Valle job Instituto de sica Universidad Aut noma de San Luis Potos Av Manuel Nava Zona Universit aria San Luis Potos xico bF cult ad de Ciencia Universidad Aut noma de San Luis Potos Av Parque Chap ul te pec Lomas del Ped regal San Luis Potos xico Institute for Nuclear Research and Nuclear Energy Bul Acad of Sc Bul Tsari gard sko Chau sse So Bulgaria Depart men to de Mate tic as Fundamental es Fa cult ad de Ciencia NED Send del Rey Madrid Spain mail mariana if is ica as lp mx pop ov au bg edu vallejo mat ned es Abstract The topology of closed manifolds forces interacting charges to appear in pairs We take advantage of this property in the setting of the conform al boundary of AdS spacetime topologically equivalent to the closed manifold by considering the coupling of two massless opposite charges on it Taking the interaction potential as the analog of Coulomb interaction derived from fundamental solution of the Laplace Beltrami operator conform al metric deformation is proposed such that free motion on the deformed metric is equivalent to motion on the round metric in the presence of the interaction potential We give explicit expressions for the generators of the conform al algebra in the representation induced by the metric deformation By identifying the charge as the color degree of freedom in QCD and the two charges system as quark anti quark system we argue that the associated conform al wave operator equation could provide realistic quantum mechanical description of the simplest QCD system the mesons Finally we discuss the possibility of employing the compact cation radius as an other scale along by means of which upon re para me tri zing as cid cid cid QCD per tub at ive treatment of processes in the infrared could be approached Corr responding Author

Simulation Based Optimization approach for analyzing the ambulance diversion phenomenon in an Emergency Department network Christian Pier marini Massimo Roma aDi parti men to di Inge gner In format ica Automatic Ges tion ale Ruber ti PIENZA Universit di Roma via rios to Roma Italy pier marini student uni roma it roma dia uni roma it Abstract Most of the studies dealing with the increasing and well known problem of Emergency Department ED overcrowding usually mainly focus on modeling the patient ow within single ED without considering the possibilities oe red by the cooperation among EDs Instead it is important to analyze the overcrowding phenomenon considering an ED network rather than single ED In this paper the Simulation Based Optimization approach is adopted for studying an ED network under die rent conditions by means of Discrete Event Simulation models In particular we consider the so called Ambulance Diversion problem analyzing die rent diversion policies Such models are carried out from real data collected from six big EDs in the Lazio region of Italy The aim is to optimize the performances of the entire network in order to provide the best service to the patients without sustaining too high costs The obtained experimental results show which are the best diversion policies both in terms of patient waiting time and costs for the service providers Keywords Simulation based Optimization Emergency Department Discrete Event Simulation Ambulance Diversion

Cambridge CB HA UK ABSTRACT As gravitational wave interferometers become more sensitive and probe evermore distant reaches the number of detected binary neutron star mergers will increase However detecting more events farther away with gravitational waves does not guarantee corresponding increase in the number of electro mag ne tic counterparts of these events Current and upcoming wide el surveys that participate in GW follow up operations will have to contend with distinguishing the kilo nova from the ever increasing number of transients they detect many of which will be consistent with the GW sky localization We have developed novel tool based on temporal convolutional neural network architecture trained on sparse early time photo me try and contextual information for Electromagnetic Counterpart Ident ica tion El CID The over arching goal for El CID is to lter through lists of new transient candidates that are consistent with the GW sky localization and determine which sources are consistent with kilo novae allowing limited target of opportunity resources to be used judiciously In addition to ver if ying the performance of our algorithm on an extensive testing sample we validate it on AT gf the only EM counterpart of binary neutron star merger discovered to date and AT pv supernova that was initially suspected as counterpart of the gravitational wave event Imaging and Image guided Therapy Medical University of Vienna Austria Department of Gynecology and Obstetrics University Hospitals Tant Egypt Abstract The performance of deep neural networks typically increases with the number of training images However not all images have the same importance towards improved performance and robustness In fe tal brain MRI abnormalities exacerbate the variability of the developing brain anatomy compared to non pathological cases small number of abnormal cases as is typically available in clinical datasets used for train ing are unlikely to fairly represent the rich variability of abnormal de vel ping brains This leads machine learning systems trained by maximizing the average performance to be biased toward non pathological cases This problem was recently referred to as hidden strat cation To be suited for clinical use automatic segmentation methods need to reliably achieve high quality segmentation outcomes also for pathological cases In this paper we show that the state of the art deep learning pipeline nU Net has di cul ties to generalize to unseen abnormal cases To mitigate this problem we propose to train deep neural network to minimize per centi le of the distribution of per volume loss over the data set We show that this can be achieved by using Distribution ally Robust Optimization Xi DR DR automatically re weights the training samples with lower performance encouraging nU Net to perform more consistently on all cases We validated our approach using data set of fetal brain MR Is including MR Is of open spina bid cases and MR Is of cases with other severe abnormalities of brain development

Decomposing the Dynamics of the Lorenz model using Unstable Periodic Orbits Averages Transitions and Quasi Periodic Sets Chiara Cecilia Maio chi and Valerio Luca rini Centre for the Mathematics of Planet Earth University of Reading and Department of Mathematics and Statistics University of Reading Unstable periodic orbits UP Os area valuable tool for studying chaotic dynamical systems They allow one to extract information from system and to distill its dynamical structure We consider here the Lorenz model with the classic parameters value and decompose its dynamics in terms of UP Os We investigate how chaotic orbit can be approximated in terms of UP Os At each instant we rank the UP Os according to their proximity to the position of the orbit in the phase space We study this process from two die rent perspectives First we nd that somewhat unexpectedly longer period UP Os overwhelmingly provide the best local approximation to the trajectory even if our UP detecting algorithm severely under samples them Second we construct nite state Markov chain by studying the scattering of the forward trajectory between the neighbourhood of the various UP Os Each UP and its neighbourhood are taken as possible state of the system We then study the transitions between the die rent states Through the analysis of the subdominant ei gen vectors of the corresponding stochastic matrix we provide novel interpretation of the mixing processes occurring in the system by taking advantage of the concept of quasi invariant sets

Physics Durham University Durham DH LE UK Department of Mathematics Presidency University College Street Kolkata India Dated August In recent years discrepancies have emerged in measurements of the present day rate of expansion of the universe and in estimates of the clustering of matterS Using the mostrecent cosmological observations we reexamine novel model proposed to address these tensions in which cold dark matter disintegrates into dark radiation The disintegration process is controlled by its rate where is constant dimensionless parameter quantifying the strength of the disintegration mechanism and His the conform al Hubble rate in the spatially at Friedman Lem at re Robertson Walker universe We constraint his model with the latest Planck temperature and polarization data showing that there is no evidence for cid and that it cannot solve the tension below clashing with the result obtained by analyzing the Planck temperature data We also investigate two possible extensions of the model in which the dark energy equation of state parameter cid In this case it is possible to combine Planck data with the SH ES measurement and we demonstrate that in both these models the tension is resolved at the level but the condition cid exacerbates the tension We also demonstrate that the addition of intermediate redshift data from the Pantheon supernova type data set and baryon acoustic oscillations weakens the eec ti ve ness of all these models to address the and tensions

Truncated Wigner approximation as non positive Kraus map Kl imov in Romero Dated August Abstract We show that the Truncated Wigner Approximation developed in the at phase space is mapped into Lindblad type evolution with an in de nite metric in the space of linear operators As result the classically evolved Wigner function corresponds to an on positive operator which does not describe physical state The rate of appearance of negative eigenvalues of can be cie ntl estimated The short time dynamics of the Kerr and second harmonic generation Hamilton in are discussed

On the Power of Differentiable Learning versus PAC and SQ Learning Emmanuel Abbe cole polytechnique drale de Lausanne EP FL emmanuel abbe ep fl ch Pri tish Kama th Google Research pri tish tic edu ranMa lach Hebrew University of Jerusalem HUJI er an mala ch mail huji ac il Colin Sandon Massachusetts Institute of Technology MIT sandon mit edu NathanS rebro Toyota Technological Institute at Chicago TIC nat tic edu Collaboration on the Theoretical Foundations of Deep Learning deep foundations Abstract We study the power of learning via mini batch stochastic gradient descent SGD on the population loss and batch Gradient Descent GD on the empirical loss of differentiable model or neural network and ask what learning problems can be learnt using these paradigms We show that SGD and GD can always simulate learning with statistical queries SQ but their ability togo beyond that depends on the precision of the gradient calculations relative to the mini batch size for SGD and sample size for GD With ne enough precision relative to mini batch size namely when is small enough SGD can go beyond SQ learning and simulate any sample based learning algorithm and thus its learning power is equivalent to that of PAC learning this extends prior work that achieved this result for Similarly with ne enough precision relative to the sample size GD can also simulate any sample based learning algorithm based on samples In particular with polynomial ly many bits of precision when is exponentially small SGD and GD can both simulate PAC learning regardless of the mini batch size On the other hand when is large enough the power of SGD is equivalent to that of SQ learning
